data.quote: It is the bold man who every time does best  at home or abroad.
data.author: Homer

data.quote: Attacking is the only secret. Dare and the world always yields  or if it beats you sometimes  dare it again  and it will succumb.
data.author: William Makepeace Thackeray

data.quote: You don't learn to hold your own in the world by standing on guard  but by attacking  and getting well-hammered yourself.
data.author: George Bernard Shaw

data.quote: Fortune helps the brave.
data.author: Virgil

data.quote: Audacity augments courage  hesitation  fear.
data.author: Publilius Syrus

data.quote: Fortune reveres the brave  and overwhelms the cowardly.
data.author: Marcus Annaeus Seneca

data.quote: God helps the brave.
data.author: J. C. F. von Schiller

data.quote: Fortune befriends the bold.
data.author: John Dryden

data.quote: Fortune and love favor the brave.
data.author: Ovid

data.quote: Fortune favors the audacious.
data.author: Erasmus

data.quote: Audacity has made kings.
data.author: Prosper Jolyot de Crebillion

data.quote: Audacity  more audacity  always audacity.
data.author: Georges Jacques Danton

data.quote: With audacity one can undertake anything.
data.author: Napoleon Bonaparte

data.quote: Bravery and faith bring both material and spiritual rewards.
data.author: Preston Bradley

data.quote: He who loses wealth loses much  he who loses a friend loses more  but he who loses his courage loses all.
data.author: Miguel de Cervantes

data.quote: True miracles are created by men when they use the courage and intelligence that God gave them.
data.author: Jean Anouilh

data.quote: Tender-handed stroke a nettle  and it stings you for your pains  Grasp it like a man of mettle  and it soft as silk remains.
data.author: Thomas Fuller

data.quote: Be content to stand in the light  and let the shadow fall where it will.
data.author: Mary W. Stewart

data.quote: Never forget that life can only be nobly inspired and rightly lived if you take it bravely and gallantly  as a splendid adventure in which you are setting out into an unknown country  to meet many a joy  to find many a comrade  to win and lose many a battle.
data.author: Annie Besant

data.quote: Life is the acceptance of responsibilities  or their evasion  it is a business of meeting obligations  or avoiding them.
data.author: Ben Ames Williams

data.quote: The superior man makes the difficulty to be overcome his first interest  success comes only later.
data.author: Confucius

data.quote: There were always in me  two women at least  one woman desperate and bewildered  who felt she was drowning and another who would leap into a scene  as upon a stage  conceal her true emotions because they were weaknesses  helplessness  despair  and present to the world only a smile  an eagerness  curiosity  enthusiasm  interest.
data.author: Anais Nin

data.quote: Facing it-always facing it-that's the way to get through. Face it!
data.author: Joseph Conrad

data.quote: If one is willing to do a thing he is afraid to do  he does not have to ... face a situation fearlessly  and [if] there is no situation to face  it falls away of its own weight.
data.author: Florence Scovel Shinn

data.quote: He shall fare well who confronts circumstances aright.
data.author: Plutarch

data.quote: He that handles a nettle tenderly is soonest stung.
data.author: Thomas Fuller

data.quote: He who is afraid of every nettle should not piss in the grass.
data.author: Thomas Fuller

data.quote: Let us be brave in the face of adversity.
data.author: Marcus Annaeus Seneca

data.quote: Only one feat is possible: not to have run away.
data.author: Dag Hammarskjold

data.quote: There is something healthy and invigorating about direct action.
data.author: Henry Miller

data.quote: Confidence ... is directness and courage in meeting the facts of life.
data.author: John Dewey

data.quote: The man who most vividly realizes a difficulty is the man most likely to overcome it.
data.author: Joseph Farrell

data.quote: I believe half the unhappiness in life comes from people being afraid to go straight at things.
data.author: William J. Lock

data.quote: No man will succeed unless he is ready to face and overcome difficulties  and is prepared to assume responsibilities.
data.author: William J. H. Boetcker

data.quote: The fly that doesn't want to be swatted is most secure when it lights on the fly-swatter.
data.author: Georg Christoph Lichtenberg

data.quote: The fly ought to be used as the symbol of impertinence and audacity  for whilst all other animals shun man more than anything else  and run away even before he comes near them  the fly lights upon his very nose.
data.author: Arthur Schopenhauer

data.quote: All problems become smaller if you don't dodge them  but confront them.
data.author: William F. Halsey

data.quote: The best way out of a problem is through it.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: We cannot solve life's problems except by solving them.
data.author: M. Scott Peck

data.quote: The truth will set you free  but first it will make you miserable.
data.author: James A. Garfield

data.quote: Have the courage to face a difficulty lest it kick you harder than you bargain for.
data.author: Stanislaus

data.quote: A great man is one who seizes the vital issue in a complex question  what we might call the jugular vein of the whole organism  and spends his energies upon that.
data.author: Joseph Rickaby

data.quote: It is often wonderful how putting down on paper a clear statement of a case helps one to see  not perhaps the way out  but the way in.
data.author: Arthur Christopher Benson

data.quote: As a rule  what is out of sight disturbs men's minds more seriously than what they see.
data.author: Julius Caesar

data.quote: Every difficulty slurred over will be a ghost to disturb your repose later on.
data.author: Frederic Chopin

data.quote: Life is a battle in which we fall from wounds we receive in running away.
data.author: William L. Sullivan

data.quote: Fools  through false shame  conceal their open wounds.
data.author: Horace

data.quote: Let us not look back in anger  nor forward in fear  but around us in awareness.
data.author: James Thurber

data.quote: It takes courage to know when you ought to be afraid.
data.author: James A. Michener

data.quote: However mean your life is  meet it and live it  do not shun it and call it hard names. It is not so bad as you are.
data.author: Henry David Thoreau

data.quote: Genius is an infinite capacity for taking life by the scruff of the neck.
data.author: Katharine Hepburn

data.quote: If you suppress grief too much  it can well redouble.
data.author: Moliere

data.quote: Bad weather always looks worse through a window.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: The frontiers are not east or west  north or south  but wherever a man fronts a fact.
data.author: Henry David Thoreau

data.quote: Should I  after tea and cakes and ices  have the strength to force the moment to its crisis?
data.author: T. S. Eliot

data.quote: Whatever you are trying to avoid won't go away until you confront it.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: None are so blind as those who will not see.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: You don't change the course of history by turning the faces of portraits to the wall.
data.author: Jawaharlal Nehru

data.quote: Soldiers  strike the foe in the face!
data.author: Florus

data.quote: Get in front of the ball  you won't get hurt. That's what you've got a chest for  young man.
data.author: John McGraw

data.quote: Knowledge of sin is the beginning of salvation.
data.author: Marcus Annaeus Seneca

data.quote: Courage is a quietness  not martial music made Born of facing up to life  even when afraid.
data.author: Emily Sargent Councilman

data.quote: The great virtue in life is real courage that knows how to face facts and live beyond them.
data.author: D. H. Lawrence

data.quote: Risk! Risk anything! ... Do the hardest thing on earth for you. Act for yourself. Face the truth.
data.author: Katherine Mansfield

data.quote: The first rule is to keep an untroubled spirit. The second is to look things in the face and know them for what they are.
data.author: Marcus Aurelius

data.quote: It is courage  courage  courage  that raises the blood of life to crimson splendor. Live bravely and present a brave front to adversity!
data.author: Horace

data.quote: It is easy to be brave from a safe distance.
data.author: Aesop

data.quote: Defending the truth is not something one does out of a sense of duty or to allay guilt complexes  but is a reward in itself.
data.author: Simone de Beauvoir

data.quote: No blame should attach to telling the truth.
data.author: Anita Brookner

data.quote: The elegance of honesty needs no adornment.
data.author: Merry Browne

data.quote: Truth is always exciting. Speak it  then  life is dull without it.
data.author: Pearl S. Buck

data.quote: You cannot weave truth on a loom of lies.
data.author: Suzette Haden Elgin

data.quote: You're only as sick as your secrets.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: You can't expect to win unless you know why you lose.
data.author: Benjamin Lipson

data.quote: It takes great courage to break with one's past history and stand alone.
data.author: Marion Woodman

data.quote: We run away all the time to avoid coming face to face with ourselves.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: Awakening begins when a man realizes that he is going nowhere  and does not know where to go.
data.author: Georges Gurdjieff

data.quote: The naked truth is always better than the best-dressed lie.
data.author: Ann Landers

data.quote: If the word frankly or sincerely is not uttered in the first ten minutes-or let us speak openly-then you are not in the presence of a genuine businessman  and he will certainly go bankrupt.
data.author: Francoise Mallet-Joris

data.quote: The man with insight enough to admit his limitations comes nearest to perfection.
data.author: Johann von Goethe

data.quote: If I ever said in grief or pride  I tired of honest things  I lied.
data.author: Edna Saint Vincent Millay

data.quote: Truth  that fair goddess who comes always with healing in her wings.
data.author: Anne Shannon Monroe

data.quote: The confession of evil works is the first beginning of good works.
data.author: Saint Augustine

data.quote: Admitting errors clears the score and proves you wiser than before.
data.author: Arthur Guiterman

data.quote: There is in the end no remedy but truth. It is the one course that cannot be evil.
data.author: Ellis Peters

data.quote: There is no power on earth more formidable than the truth.
data.author: Margaret Lee Runbeck

data.quote: If one cannot invent a really convincing lie  it is often better to stick to the truth.
data.author: Angela Thirkell

data.quote: An excuse is a lie guarded.
data.author: Jonathan Swift

data.quote: Honesty is the first chapter of the book of wisdom.
data.author: Thomas Jefferson

data.quote: Truth is the vital breath of Beauty  Beauty the outward form of Truth.
data.author: Grace Aguilar

data.quote: The trouble with lying and deceiving is that their efficiency depends entirely upon a clear notion of the truth that the liar and deceiver wishes to hide.
data.author: Hannah Arendt

data.quote: There is at least one thing more brutal than the truth  and that is the consequence of saying less than the truth.
data.author: Ti-Grace Atkinson

data.quote: The real gift of love is self disclosure.
data.author: John Powell

data.quote: We only really face up to ourselves when we are afraid.
data.author: Thomas Bernhard

data.quote: It takes a lot of courage to show your dreams to someone else.
data.author: Erma Bombeck

data.quote: It takes more courage to reveal insecurities than to hide them  more strength to relate to people than to dominate them  more "manhood" to abide by thought-out principles rather than blind reflex. Toughness is in the soul and spirit  not in muscles and an immature mind.
data.author: Alex Karras

data.quote: I have often though morality may perhaps consist solely in the courage of making a choice.
data.author: Leon Blum

data.quote: Introversion  at least if extreme  is a sign of mental and spiritual immaturity.
data.author: Pearl S. Buck

data.quote: The highest courage is to dare to appear to be what one is.
data.author: John Lancaster Spalding

data.quote: It isn't for the moment you are stuck that you need courage  but for the long uphill climb back to sanity and faith and security.
data.author: Anne Morrow Lindbergh

data.quote: True courage is not the brutal force of vulgar heroes  but the firm resolve of virtue and reason.
data.author: Alfred North Whitehead

data.quote: Greatness  in the last analysis  is largely bravery-courage in escaping from old ideas and old standards.
data.author: James Harvey Robinson

data.quote: The highest courage is not to be found in the instinctive acts of men who risk their lives to save a friend or slay a foe  the physical fearlessness of a moment or an hour is not to be compared with immolation of months or years for the sake of wisdom or art.
data.author: Joseph H. Odell

data.quote: I have met brave women who are exploring the outer edge of human possibility  with no history to guide them  and with a courage to make themselves vulnerable that I find moving beyond words.
data.author: Gloria Steinem

data.quote: Valour is nobleness of the mind.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: Courage ... is nothing less than the power to overcome danger  misfortune  fear  injustice  while continuing to affirm inwardly that life  with all its sorrows  is good  that everything is meaningful  even if in a sense beyond our understanding  and that there is always tomorrow.
data.author: Dorothy Thompson

data.quote: This is the art of courage: to see things as they are and still believe that the victory lies not with those who avoid the bad  but those who taste  in living awareness  every drop of the good.
data.author: Victoria Lincoln

data.quote: God grant me the courage not to give up what I think is right  even though I think it is hopeless.
data.author: Admiral Chester W. Nimitz

data.quote: The great virtue in life is real courage that knows how to face facts and live beyond them.
data.author: D. H. Lawrence

data.quote: Physical courage  which despises all danger  will make a man brave in one way  and moral courage  which despises all opinion  will make a man brave in another. The former would seem most necessary for the camp  the latter for the council  but to constitute a great man  both are necessary.
data.author: Charles Caleb Colton

data.quote: Courage is the power to let go of the familiar.
data.author: Raymond Lindquist

data.quote: Valor is stability  not of legs and arms  but of courage and the soul.
data.author: Michel de Montaigne

data.quote: One of man's finest qualities is described by the simple word "guts"-the ability to take it. If you have the discipline to stand fast when your body wants to run  if you can control your temper and remain cheerful in the face of monotony or disappointment  you have "guts" in the soldiering sense.
data.author: Colonel John S. Roosman

data.quote: Whatever course you decide upon  there is always someone to tell you that you are wrong. There are always difficulties arising which tempt you to believe that your critics are right. To map out a course of action and follow it to an end requires ... courage.
data.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

data.quote: Courage is more than standing for a firm conviction. It includes the risk of questioning that conviction.
data.author: Julian Weber Gordon

data.quote: The hallmark of courage in our age of conformity is the capacity to stand on one's convictions-not obstinately or defiantly (these are gestures of defensiveness  not courage) nor as a gesture of retaliation  but simply because these are what one believes.
data.author: Rollo May

data.quote: Courage is what it takes to stand up and speak  courage is also what it takes to sit down and listen.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: The greatest test of courage on earth is to bear defeat without losing heart.
data.author: Robert G. Ingersoll

data.quote: Courage is to take hard knocks like a man when occasion calls.
data.author: Plautus

data.quote: You don't develop courage by being happy in your relationships everyday. You develop it by surviving difficult times and challenging adversity.
data.author: Barbara De Angelis

data.quote: This is courage ... to bear unflinchingly what heaven sends.
data.author: Euripides

data.quote: Courage  in the final analysis  is nothing but an affirmative answer to the shocks of existence.
data.author: Dr. Kurt Goldstein

data.quote: Courage is a perfect sensibility of the measure of danger  and a mental willingness to endure it.
data.author: General William T. Sherman

data.quote: To have courage for whatever comes in life-everything lies in that.
data.author: Teresa of Avila

data.quote: To accept whatever comes  regardless of the consequences  is to be unafraid.
data.author: John Cage

data.quote: The test of courage comes when we are in the minority.
data.author: Ralph W. Sockman

data.quote: One man with courage makes a majority.
data.author: Andrew Jackson

data.quote: Many women miss their greatest chance of happiness through a want of courage in a decisive moment.
data.author: Winifred Gordon

data.quote: We must have the courage to be happy.
data.author: Henri Frederic Amiel

data.quote: There is a courage of happiness as well as a courage of sorrow.
data.author: Maurice Maeterlinck

data.quote: Happy the man who ventures boldly to defend what he holds dear.
data.author: Ovid

data.quote: All happiness depends on courage and work.
data.author: Honore de Balzac

data.quote: There is nothing in the world so much admired as a man who knows how to bear unhappiness with courage.
data.author: Marcus Annaeus Seneca

data.quote: We must have courage to bet on our ideas  on the calculated risk  and to act. Everyday living requires courage if life is to be effective and bring happiness.
data.author: Maxwell Maltz

data.quote: Faint heart never won fair lady.
data.author: Miguel de Cervantes

data.quote: The last thing a woman will consent to discover in a man whom she loves  or on whom she simply depends  is want of courage.
data.author: Joseph Conrad

data.quote: None but the brave deserve the fair.
data.author: John Dryden

data.quote: Fortune and love favor the brave.
data.author: Ovid

data.quote: The bravest are the tenderest. The loving are the daring.
data.author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

data.quote: The weapon of the brave is in his heart.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: The guts carry the feet  not the feet the guts.
data.author: Miguel de Cervantes

data.quote: I am not afraid of a fight  I have to do my duty  come what may.
data.author: Therese of Lisieux

data.quote: War is fear cloaked in courage.
data.author: General William Westmoreland

data.quote: A bold heart is half the battle.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: Courage in danger is half the battle.
data.author: Plautus

data.quote: A man of courage never wants weapons.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: A brave arm makes a short sword long.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: Courage which goes against military expediency is stupidity  or  if it is insisted upon by a commander  irresponsibility.
data.author: Field Marshal Erwin Rommel

data.quote: There is  in addition to a courage with which men die  a courage by which men must live.
data.author: John F. Kennedy

data.quote: Where life is more terrible than death  it is the truest valor to dare to live.
data.author: Sir Thomas Browne

data.quote: The courage we desire and prize is not the courage to die decently  but to live manfully.
data.author: Thomas Carlyle

data.quote: Often the test of courage is not to die  but to live.
data.author: Conte Vittorio Alfieri

data.quote: He who has the courage to laugh is almost as much the master of the world as he who is ready to die.
data.author: Giacomo Leopardi

data.quote: Life shrinks or expands in proportion to one's courage.
data.author: Anais Nin

data.quote: Only those are fit to live who are not afraid to die.
data.author: General Douglas MacArthur

data.quote: Sometimes even to live is an act of courage.
data.author: Marcus Annaeus Seneca

data.quote: To say yes  you have to sweat and roll up your sleeves and plunge both hands into life up to the elbows. It is easy to say no  even if saying no means death.
data.author: Jean Anouilh

data.quote: Have the courage to live. Anyone can die.

data.quote: Because a fellow has failed once or twice or a dozen times  you don't want to set him down as a failure till he's dead or loses his courage-and that's the same thing.
data.author: George Horace Lorimer

data.quote: What is more mortifying than to feel that you have missed the plum for want of courage to shake the tree?
data.author: Logan Pearsall Smith

data.quote: Yesterday I dared to struggle. Today I dare to win.
data.author: Bernadette Devlin

data.quote: To persevere  trusting in what hopes he has  is courage. The coward despairs.
data.author: Euripides

data.quote: It takes vision and courage to create- it takes faith and courage to prove.
data.author: Owen D. Young

data.quote: Whatever you do  you need courage. ... To map out a course of action and follow it to an end requires some of the same courage which a soldier needs.
data.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

data.quote: Who dares nothing  need hope for nothing.
data.author: J. C. F. von Schiller

data.quote: Have the courage of your desire.
data.author: George R. Gissing

data.quote: To see what is right  and not do it  is want of courage.
data.author: Confucius

data.quote: No great thing conies to any man unless he has courage.
data.author: Cardinal James Gibbons

data.quote: Great things are done more through courage than through wisdom.
data.author: German proverb

data.quote: Courage permits the caliber of performance to continue at its peak  until the finish line is crossed.
data.author: Stuart Walker

data.quote: Failure is only postponed success as long as courage "coaches" ambition. The habit of persistence is the habit of victory.
data.author: Herbert Kaufman

data.quote: Courage and perseverance have a magical talisman  before which difficulties disappear  and obstacles vanish into air.
data.author: John Quincy Adams

data.quote: There are a lot of fellas with all the ability it takes to play in the major leagues  but... they always get stuck in the minor leagues because they haven't got the guts to make the climb.
data.author: Cookie Lavagetto

data.quote: Where there is a brave man  in the thickest of the fight  there is the post of honor.
data.author: Henry David Thoreau

data.quote: It takes as much courage to have tried and failed as it does to have tried and succeeded.
data.author: Anne Morrow Lindbergh

data.quote: You will never do anything in this world without courage.
data.author: James Lane Allen

data.quote: Whenever you see a successful business  someone once made a courageous decision.
data.author: Peter Drucker

data.quote: Courage to start and willingness to keep everlasting at it are the requisites for success.
data.author: Alonzo Newton Benn

data.quote: One of the biggest factors in success is the courage to undertake something.
data.author: James A. Worsham

data.quote: Everyone has a talent. What is rare is the courage to follow that talent to the dark place where it leads.
data.author: Erica Jong

data.quote: The world is not perishing for the want of clever or talented or well-meaning men. It is perishing for the want of men of courage and resolution.
data.author: Robert J. McCracken

data.quote: Talent is helpful in writing  but guts are absolutely necessary.
data.author: Jessamyn West

data.quote: Knowledge without courage is sterile.
data.author: Baltasar Gracian

data.quote: To create one's own world in any of the arts takes courage.
data.author: Georgia O'Keeffe

data.quote: Courage is the thing. All goes if courage goes.
data.author: Sir James M. Barrie

data.quote: It's weak and despicable to go on wanting things and not trying to get them.
data.author: Joanna Field

data.quote: How many feasible projects have miscarried through despondency  and been strangled in their birth by a cowardly imagination?
data.author: Jeremy Collier

data.quote: It is brave to be involved.
data.author: Gwendolyn Brooks

data.quote: One of the biggest factors in success is the courage to undertake something.
data.author: James A. Worsham

data.quote: When it comes to betting on yourself ... you're a chicken-livered coward if you hesitate.
data.author: B. C. Forbes

data.quote: What would life be if we had no courage to attempt anything?
data.author: Vincent van Gogh

data.quote: Be courageous! ... I have seen many depressions in business. Always America has come out stronger and more prosperous. Be as brave as your fathers before you. Have faith! Go forward.
data.author: Thomas A. Edison

data.quote: Dare to begin! He who postpones living rightly is like the rustic who waits for the river to run out before he crosses.
data.author: Horace

data.quote: Nothing ventured  nothing gained.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: The brave venture anything.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: The difference between getting somewhere and nowhere is the courage to make an early start.
data.author: Charles M. Schwab

data.quote: Life is to be entered upon with courage.
data.author: Alexis de Tocqueville

data.quote: We ought to face our destiny with courage.
data.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

data.quote: You can surmount the obstacles in your path if you are determined  courageous and hardworking. ... Do not fear to pioneer  to venture down new paths of endeavor.
data.author: Ralph J. Bunche

data.quote: The great man is the man who does a thing for the first time.
data.author: Alexander Smith

data.quote: Imposing limitations on yourself is cowardly because it protects you from having to try  and perhaps failing.
data.author: Vladimir Zworykin

data.quote: What you can do  or dream you can do  begin it  boldness has genius  power and magic in it.
data.author: Johann von Goethe

data.quote: We need the courage to start and continue what we should do  and courage to stop what we shouldn't do.
data.author: Richard L. Evans

data.quote: Prudence which degenerates into timidity is very seldom the path to safety.
data.author: Viscount Cecil

data.quote: He that is overcautious will accomplish little.
data.author: J. C. F. von Schiller

data.quote: We can easily become as much slaves to precaution as we can to fear.
data.author: Randolph Bourne

data.quote: To the timid and hesitating everything is impossible because it seems so.
data.author: Sir Walter Scott

data.quote: Do not be too timid and squeamish. ... All life is an experiment. The more experiments you make  the better.
data.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

data.quote: Courage is rarely reckless or foolish ... courage usually involves a highly realistic estimate of the odds that must be faced.
data.author: Margaret Truman

data.quote: Valour lies just halfway between rashness and cowardice.
data.author: Miguel de Cervantes

data.quote: When you're my size in the pros  fear is a sign that you're not stupid.
data.author: Jerry Levias

data.quote: Keep your fears to yourself  but share your courage with others.
data.author: Robert Louis Stevenson

data.quote: Courage leads starward  fear toward death.
data.author: Marcus Annaeus Seneca

data.quote: Go forth to meet the shadowy Future without fear and with a manly heart.
data.author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

data.quote: Fate loves the fearless.
data.author: James Russell Lowell

data.quote: There is no such thing as bravery  only degrees of fear.
data.author: John Wainwright

data.quote: Courage is a peculiar kind of fear.
data.author: Charles Kennedy

data.quote: Courage is fear that has said its prayers.
data.author: Dorothy Bernard

data.quote: Courage is fear holding on a minute longer.
data.author: General George S. Patton

data.quote: Courage is the ability to solve problems realistically in the presence of fear.
data.author: Stuart Walker

data.quote: Courage is resistance to fear  mastery of fear-not absence of fear.
data.author: Mark Twain

data.quote: Courage is ... the knowledge of how to fear what ought to be feared and how not to fear what ought not to be feared.
data.author: David Ben-Gurion

data.quote: Courage is knowing what not to fear.
data.author: Plato

data.quote: Courage is the right disposition toward fear.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: Courage is a scorner of things which inspire fear.
data.author: Marcus Annaeus Seneca

data.quote: We must constantly build dykes of courage to hold back the flood of fear.
data.author: Martin Luther King, Jr.

data.quote: Courage is never letting your actions be influenced by your fears.
data.author: Arthur Koestler

data.quote: Cowards cannot see that their greatest safety lies in dauntless courage.
data.author: Johann Kaspar Lavater

data.quote: A coward turns away  but a brave man's choice is danger.
data.author: Euripides

data.quote: Cowardice is the mother of cruelty.
data.author: Michel de Montaigne

data.quote: Optimism and self-pity are the positive and negative poles of modern cowardice.
data.author: Cyril Connolly

data.quote: Cowards die many times before their deaths  the valiant never taste of death but once.
data.author: William Shakespeare

data.quote: To say a person is a coward has no more meaning than to say he is lazy: It simply tells us that some vital potentiality is unrealized or blocked.
data.author: Rollo May

data.quote: There are at least two kinds of cowards. One kind always lives with himself  afraid to face the world. The other kind lives with the world  afraid to face himself.
data.author: Roscoe Snowden

data.quote: There is a time when to avoid trouble is to store up trouble  and when to seek for a lazy and a cowardly peace is to court a still greater danger.
data.author: William Barclay

data.quote: To know what is right and not do it is the worst cowardice.
data.author: Confucius

data.quote: Spiritual cowardice is not only weakness but wickedness.
data.author: J. B. Gambrell

data.quote: The most mortifying infirmity in human nature ... is  perhaps  cowardice.
data.author: Charles Lamb

data.quote: Men perish by the sword  cowards by disease.
data.author: Phillippus

data.quote: Between cowardice and despair  valour is gendered.
data.author: John Donne

data.quote: If you knew how cowardly your enemy is  you would slap him.
data.author: Edgar Watson Howe

data.quote: Bravery is the knowledge of the cowardice in the enemy.
data.author: Edgar Watson Howe

data.quote: Any coward can fight a battle when he's sure of winning.
data.author: George Eliot

data.quote: The coward despairs.
data.author: Euripides

data.quote: Cowardice  as distinguished from panic  is almost always simply a lack of ability to suspend the functioning of the imagination.
data.author: Ernest Hemingway

data.quote: The only cowards are sinners  fighting the fight is all.
data.author: John G. Neihardt

data.quote: All men would be cowards if they durst.
data.author: John Wilmot, Earl of Rochester

data.quote: That cowardice is incorrigible which the love of power cannot overcome.
data.author: Charles Caleb Colton

data.quote: Courage is doing what you're afraid to do. There can be no courage unless you're scared.
data.author: Eddie Rickenbacker

data.quote: Courage is being scared to death ... and saddling up anyway.
data.author: John Wayne

data.quote: You look at a guy who's being brave. He's afraid  or he wouldn't be brave. If he isn't afraid  he's stupid.
data.author: Joe Torre

data.quote: To fight a bull when you are not scared is nothing. And to not fight a bull when you are scared is nothing. But to fight a bull when you are scared is something.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: Being "brave" means doing or facing something frightening. ... Being "fearless" means being without fear.
data.author: Penelope Leach

data.quote: It takes courage to know when you ought to be afraid.
data.author: James A. Michener

data.quote: Everyone thought I was bold and fearless and even arrogant  but inside I was always quaking.
data.author: Katharine Hepburn

data.quote: Perfect courage means doing unwitnessed what we would be capable of with the world looking on.
data.author: Francois de La Rochefoucauld

data.quote: Fear is the single strongest motivating force in our lives. ... The more frightened you become  the better your chances of achieving success.
data.author: Lois Korey

data.quote: Bravery is the capacity to perform properly even when scared half to death. -General Omar N. Bradley This morning I threw up at a board meeting. I was sure the cat was out of the bag  but no one seemed to think anything about it  apparently it's quite common for people to throw up at board meetings.
data.author: Jane Wagner

data.quote: I'm a real pussycat-with an iron tail.
data.author: Rona Barrett

data.quote: Bravery is being the only one who knows you're afraid.
data.author: Franklin P. Jones

data.quote: Necessity makes even the timid brave.
data.author: Sallust

data.quote: Necessity does the work of courage.
data.author: Nicholas Murray Butler

data.quote: I became more courageous by doing the very things I needed to be courageous for-first  a little  and badly. Then  bit by bit  more and better. Being avidly-sometimes annoy-ingly-curious and persistent about discovering how others were doing what I wanted to do.
data.author: Audre Lorde

data.quote: When it comes to the pinch  human beings are heroic.
data.author: George Orwell

data.quote: Many become brave when brought to bag.
data.author: Norwegian proverb

data.quote: Courage mounteth with occasion.
data.author: William Shakespeare

data.quote: When you have no choice  mobilize the spirit of courage.
data.author: Jewish proverb

data.quote: Courage is sustained by calling up anew the vision of the goal.
data.author: A. G. Sertillanges

data.quote: Women have to summon up courage to fulfill dormant dreams.
data.author: Alice Walker

data.quote: Courage is like love  it must have hope for nourishment.
data.author: Napoleon Bonaparte

data.quote: Optimism is the foundation of courage.
data.author: Nicholas Murray Butler

data.quote: I would often be a coward  but for the shame of it.
data.author: Ralph Connor

data.quote: At the bottom of a good deal of bravery ... lurks a miserable cowardice. Men will face powder and steel because they cannot face public opinion.
data.author: Edwin H. Chapin

data.quote: We would be cowards  if we had courage enough.
data.author: Thomas Fuller

data.quote: A coward's fear can make a coward valiant.
data.author: Thomas Fuller

data.quote: Courage is as often the outcome of despair as of hope  in the one case we have nothing to lose  in the other everything to gain.
data.author: Diane de Poitiers

data.quote: Despair gives courage to a coward.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: No one has yet computed how many imaginary triumphs are silently celebrated by people each year to keep up their courage.
data.author: Henry S. Haskins

data.quote: I'm not afraid of too many things  and I got that invincible kind of attitude from my father.
data.author: Reinhold Niebuhr

data.quote: Courage is the fear of being thought a coward.
data.author: Horace Smith

data.quote: How  then  find the courage for action? By slipping a little into unconsciousness  spontaneity  instinct which holds one to the earth and dictates the relatively good and useful. ... By accepting the human condition more simply  and candidly  by dreading troubles less  calculating less  hoping more.
data.author: Henri Frederic Amiel

data.quote: It takes courage to live-courage and strength and hope and humor. And courage and strength and hope and humor have to be bought and paid for with pain and work and prayers and tears.
data.author: Jerome P. Fleishman

data.quote: Courage that grows from constitution often forsakes a man ... courage which arises from a sense of duty acts in a uniform manner.
data.author: Joseph Addison

data.quote: He who knows how to suffer everything can dare everything.
data.author: Vauvenargues

data.quote: Courage does not always march to airs blown by a bugle  it is not always wrought out of the fabric ostentation wears.
data.author: Frances Rodman

data.quote: We learn courageous action by going forward whenever fear urges us back.
data.author: David Seabury

data.quote: The paradox of courage is that a man must be a little careless of his life in order to keep it.
data.author: G. K. Chesterton

data.quote: All men are afraid in battle. The coward is the one who lets his fear overcome his sense of duty. Duty is the essence of manhood.
data.author: General George S. Patton

data.quote: Courage isrequired not only in a person's occasional crucial decision for his own freedom  but in the little hour-to-hour decisions which place the bricks in the structure of his building of himself into a person who acts with freedom and responsibility.
data.author: Rollo May

data.quote: Courage does not consist in calculation  but in fighting against chances.
data.author: John Henry Cardinal Newman

data.quote: Courage is its own reward.
data.author: Plautus

data.quote: Courage is the price that life exacts for granting peace.
data.author: Amelia Earhart

data.quote: Courage is a kind of salvation.
data.author: Plato

data.quote: Courage is grace under pressure.
data.author: Ernest Hemingway

data.quote: Courage is the lovely virtue-the rib of Himself that God sent down to His children.
data.author: Sir James M. Barrie

data.quote: Courage is the integrating strength that causes one to overcome tragedy.
data.author: Eugene E. Brussell

data.quote: Courage is almost a contradiction in terms. It means a strong desire to live taking the form of readiness to die.
data.author: G. K. Chesterton

data.quote: Courage is the virtue which champions the cause of right.
data.author: Cicero

data.quote: Courage is generosity of the highest order  for the brave are prodigal of the most precious things.
data.author: Charles Caleb Colton

data.quote: Courage is clearly a readiness to risk self-humiliation.
data.author: Nigel Dennis

data.quote: Courage is fire  and bullying is smoke.
data.author: Benjamin Disraeli

data.quote: Courage consists of the power of self-recovery.
data.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

data.quote: Courage is a virtue only so far as it is directed by prudence.
data.author: Francois de Fenelon

data.quote: Courage is a quality so necessary for maintaining virtue that it is always respected even when it is associated with vice.
data.author: Samuel Johnson

data.quote: Courage is the footstool of the Virtues  upon which they stand.
data.author: Robert Louis Stevenson

data.quote: Courage is to feel the daily daggers of relentless steel and keep on living.
data.author: Douglas Malloch

data.quote: Courage is what preserves our liberty  safety  life  and our homes and parents  our country and children. Courage comprises all things.
data.author: Plautus

data.quote: Courage is a peculiar kind of fear.
data.author: Charles Kennedy

data.quote: There is plenty of courage among us for the abstract  but not for the concrete.
data.author: Helen Keller

data.quote: Every man has his own courage  and is betrayed because he seeks in himself the courage of other persons.
data.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

data.quote: If we have the courage and tenacity of our forebears  who stood firmly like a rock against the lash of slavery  we shall find a way to do for our day what they did for theirs.
data.author: Mary McLeod Bethune

data.quote: If you are brave too often  people will come to expect it of you.
data.author: Mignon McLaughlin

data.quote: The best protection any woman can have ... is courage.
data.author: Elizabeth Cady Stanton

data.quote: Valor is a gift. Those having it never know for sure if they have it till the test comes. And those having it in one test never know for sure if they will have it when the next test comes.
data.author: Carl Sandburg

data.quote: Until the day of his death  no man can be sure of his courage.
data.author: Jean Anouilh

data.quote: Among wellborn spirits courage does not depend on age.
data.author: Pierre Corneille

data.quote: Courage can't see around corners  but goes around them anyway.
data.author: Mignon McLaughlin

data.quote: Freedom is not for the timid.
data.author: Vijaya Lakshmi Pandit

data.quote: Courage easily finds its own eloquence.
data.author: Plautus

data.quote: In true courage there is always an element of choice  of an ethical choice  and of anguish  and also of action and deed. There is always a flame of spirit in it  a vision of some necessity higher than oneself.
data.author: Brenda Ueland

data.quote: But screw your courage to the sticking place and we'll not fail.
data.author: William Shakespeare

data.quote: Courage is always the surest wisdom.
data.author: Wilfred Grenfell

data.quote: Courage is very important. Like a muscle  it is strengthened by use.
data.author: Ruth Gordon

data.quote: There are some women who seem to be born without fear  just as there are people who are born without the ability to feel pain. ... Providence appears to protect such women  maybe out of astonishment.
data.author: Margaret Atwood

data.quote: On many of the great issues of our time  men have lacked wisdom because they have lacked courage.
data.author: William Benton

data.quote: Catch courage.
data.author: Carolyn Heilbrun

data.quote: If you are scared to go to the brink  you are lost.
data.author: John Foster Dulles

data.quote: It takes courage to lead a life. Any life.
data.author: Erica Jong

data.quote: Nothing is as valuable to a man as courage.
data.author: Terence

data.quote: I'd rather give my life than be afraid to give it.
data.author: Lyndon B. Johnson

data.quote: The only courage that matters is the kind that gets you from one moment to the next.
data.author: Mignon McLaughlin

data.quote: Courage ought to have eyes as well as arms.
data.author: H. G. Bohn

data.quote: Sorrow is a fruit. God does not allow it to grow on a branch that is too weak to bear it.
data.author: Victor Hugo

data.quote: The will of God will not take you where the grace of God cannot keep you.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: Act  and God will act.
data.author: Joan of Arc

data.quote: So when the crisis is upon you  remember that God  like a trainer of wrestlers  has matched you with a tough and stalwart antagonist... that you may prove a victor at the Great Games.
data.author: Epictetus

data.quote: Act boldly and unseen forces will come to your aid.
data.author: Dorothea Brande

data.quote: What God expects us to attempt  He also enables us to achieve.
data.author: Stephen Olford

data.quote: God gave burdens  also shoulders.
data.author: Yiddish proverb

data.quote: With them I gladly shared my all and learned the great truth that where God guides  He provides.
data.author: Frank N. D. Buchman

data.quote: The Bible tells us that a sparrow does not fall without God's notice. I know he will help us meet our responsibilities through his guidance.
data.author: Michael Cardone

data.quote: Leap  and the net will appear.
data.author: Julie Cameron

data.quote: Cowards falter  but danger is often overcome by those who nobly dare.
data.author: Queen Elizabeth I

data.quote: God gives us always strength enough  and sense enough  for everything He wants us to do.
data.author: John Ruskin

data.quote: Fatalism is a lazy man's way of accepting the inevitable.
data.author: Natalie Clifford Barney

data.quote: In this unbelievable universe in which we live  there are no absolutes. Even parallel lines  reaching into infinity  meet somewhere yonder.
data.author: Pearl S. Buck

data.quote: Instead of looking at life as a narrowing funnel  we can see it ever widening to choose the things we want to do  to take the wisdom we've learned and create something.
data.author: Liz Carpenter

data.quote: Nothing befalls a man except what is in his nature to endure.
data.author: Marcus Aurelius

data.quote: Life only demands from you the strength you possess.
data.author: Dag Hammarskjold

data.quote: Everyone will be taxed according to his means.
data.author: J. C. F. von Schiller

data.quote: I discovered I always have choices and sometimes it's only a choice of attitude.
data.author: Judith M. Knowlton

data.quote: The burden is equal to the horse's strength.
data.author: Talmud

data.quote: Experience shows that exceptions are as true as rules.
data.author: Edith Ronald Mirrielees

data.quote: What we call reality is an agreement that people have arrived at to make their lives more livable.
data.author: Louise Nevelson

data.quote: All we are asked to bear we can bear. That is a law of the spiritual life. The only hindrance to the working of this law  as of all benign laws  is fear.
data.author: Elizabeth Goudge

data.quote: When it comes to the pinch  human beings are heroic.
data.author: George Orwell

data.quote: The incurable ills are the imaginary ills
data.author: Marie von Ebner-Eschenbach

data.quote: However confused the scene of our life appears  however torn we may be who now do face that scene  it can be faced  and we can go on to be whole.
data.author: Muriel Rukeyser

data.quote: A change of heart is the essence of all other change  and it has brought about me a reeducation of the mind.
data.author: Emmeline Pethick-Lawrence

data.quote: The human spirit is stronger than anything that can happen to it.
data.author: George. C. Scott

data.quote: What one has to do usually can be done.
data.author: Eleanor Roosevelt

data.quote: Man performs and engenders so much more than he can or should have to bear. That's how he finds that he can bear anything.
data.author: William Faulkner

data.quote: If you have enough fantasies  you're ready  in the event that something happens.
data.author: Sheila Ballantyne

data.quote: The peril of the hour moved the British to tremendous exertions  just as always in a moment of extreme danger things can be done which had previously been thought impossible. Mortal danger is an effective antidote for fixed ideas.
data.author: Field Marshal Erwin Rommel

data.quote: We all carry it within us: supreme strength  the fullness of wisdom  unquenchable joy. It is never thwarted  and cannot be destroyed.
data.author: Huston Smith

data.quote: Within us all there are wells of thought and dynamos of energy which are not suspected until emergencies arise. Then oftentimes we find that it is comparatively simple to double or triple our former capacities and to amaze ourselves by the results achieved.
data.author: Thomas J. Watson

data.quote: The spirit of man is an inward flame  a lamp the world blows upon but never puts out.
data.author: Margot Asquith

data.quote: We have what we seek. It is there all the time  and if we give it time  it will make itself known to us.
data.author: Thomas Merton

data.quote: Truth is not introduced into the individual from without  but was within him all the time.
data.author: Soren Kierkegaard

data.quote: Nature arms each man with some faculty which enables him to do easily some feat impossible to any other.
data.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

data.quote: When we know what we want to prove  we go out and find our facts. They are always there.
data.author: Pearl S. Buck

data.quote: Nature reacts not only to physical disease  but also to moral weakness  when the danger increases  she gives us greater courage.
data.author: Johann von Goethe

data.quote: rouble creates a capacity to handle it.
data.author: Oliver Wendell Holmes

data.quote: Trouble  like the hill ahead  straightens out when you advance upon it.
data.author: Marcelene Cox

data.quote: In the darkest hour the soul is replenished and given strength to continue and endure.
data.author: Heart Warrior Chosa

data.quote: Our energy is in proportion to the resistance it meets. We attempt nothing great but from a sense of the difficulties we have to encounter  we persevere in nothing great but from a pride in overcoming them.
data.author: William Hazlitt

data.quote: We shall draw from the heart of suffering itself the means of inspiration and survival.
data.author: Winston Churchill

data.quote: Exigencies create the necessary ability to meet and conquer them.
data.author: Wendell Phillips

data.quote: The moment one definitely commits oneself  then Providence moves too. All sorts of things occur to help that would never otherwise have occurred. A stream of events issues from the decision  raising unforeseen incidents and meetings and material assistance  which no man could have dreamt would have come his way.
data.author: W. H. Murray

data.quote: In forty hours I shall be in battle  with little information  and on the spur of the moment will have to make the most momentous decisions. But I believe that one's spirit enlarges with responsibility and that  with God's help  I shall make them  and make them right.
data.author: General George S. Patton

data.quote: Often the test of courage is not to die but to live.
data.author: Vittorio Conte Alfieri

data.quote: A man of courage is also full of faith.
data.author: Cicero

data.quote: When moral courage feels that it is in the right  there is no personal daring of which it is incapable.
data.author: Leigh Hunt

data.quote: Fortune and Love befriend the bold.
data.author: Ovid

data.quote: Women and men of retiring timidity are cowardly only in dangers which affect themselves  but the first to rescue when others are endangered.
data.author: Jean Paul Richter

data.quote: Hail  Caesar  those who are about to die salute thee.
data.author: Suetonius

data.quote: The small courtesies sweeten life  the greater ennoble it.
data.author: Christian Nestell Bovee

data.quote: A moral  sensible  and well-bred man Will not affront me  and no other can.
data.author: William Cowper

data.quote: He who fights and runs away May live to fight another day. But he who is in battle slain  Can never rise to fight again.
data.author: Oliver Goldsmith

data.quote: A cowardly act! What do I care about that? You may be sure that I should never fear to commit one if it were to my advantage.
data.author: Napoleon

data.quote: A cowardly cur barks more fiercely than it bites.
data.author: Quintus Curtius Rufus

data.quote: All men would be cowards if they durst.
data.author: Earl of Rochester

data.quote: One who in a perilous emergency thinks with his legs.
data.author: Ambrose Bierce

data.quote: Personal liberty is the paramount essential to human dignity and human happiness.
data.author: Edward G. Bulwer-Lytton

data.quote: Hereditary boundsmen! Know ye not Who would be free themselves must strike the blow?
data.author: Lord Byron

data.quote: And Freedom shrieked as Kosciusko fell!
data.author: Thomas Campbell

data.quote: In a free country there is much clamor  with little suffering  in a despotic state there is little complaint  with much grievance.
data.author: Lazare Carnot

data.quote: For what avail the plough or sail  Or land  or life  if freedom fail?
data.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

data.quote: Ay  call it holy ground  The soil where first they trod  They have left unstained  what there they found  -  Freedom to worship God.
data.author: Felicia D. Hemans

data.quote: In the beauty of the lilies Christ was born across the sea  With a glory in His bosom that transfigures you and me  As He died to make men holy  let us die to make men free  While God is marching on.
data.author: Julia Ward Howe

data.quote: I am for freedom of religion and against all maneuvers to bring about a legal ascendancy of one sect over another.
data.author: Thomas Jefferson

data.quote: And ye shall know the truth  and the truth shall make you free.
data.author: Bible

data.quote: Those who deny freedom to others deserve it not for themselves and under a just God cannot long retain it.
data.author: Abraham Lincoln

data.quote: ... That this nation  under God  shall have a new birth of freedom.
data.author: Abraham Lincoln

data.quote: Since the general civilization of mankind I believe there are more instances of the abridgement of the freedom of the people by gradual and silent encroachments of those in power than by violent and sudden usurpations.
data.author: James Madison

data.quote: The only freedom which deserves the name is that of pursuing our own good in our own way  so long as we do not attempt to deprive others of theirs or impede their efforts to obtain it.
data.author: John Stuart Mill

data.quote: We must be free or die  who speak the tongue That Shakespeare spake  the faith and morals hold Which Milton held.
data.author: William Wordsworth

data.quote: No amount of political freedom will satisfy the hungry masses.
data.author: Vladimir Lenin

data.quote: I would rather sit on a pumpkin  and have it all to myself  than to be crowded on a velvet cushion.
data.author: Henry David Thoreau

data.quote: I never saw a Purple Cow  I never hope to see one: But I can tell you  anyhow I'd rather see than be one.
data.author: Gelett Burgess

data.quote: There was an old man who said  "How Shall I flee from this horrible cow? I will sit on this stile  and continue to smile  Which may soften the heart of that cow."
data.author: Edward Lear

data.quote: The reality is that changes are coming. ... They must come. You must share in bringing them.
data.author: John Hersey

data.quote: After you've done a thing the same way for two years  look it over carefully. After five years  look at it with suspicion. And after ten years  throw it away and start all over.
data.author: Alfred Edward Perlman

data.quote: All that philosophers have done is interpret the world in different ways. It is our job to change it.
data.author: Karl Marx

data.quote: Christians are supposed not merely to endure change  nor even to profit by it  but to cause it.
data.author: Harry Emerson Fosdick

data.quote: If you have no will to change it  you have no right to criticize it.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: Changes are not predictable  but to deny them is to be an accomplice to one's own unnecessary vegetation.
data.author: Gail Sheehy

data.quote: We must learn to view change as a natural phenomenon-to anticipate it and to plan for it. The future is ours to channel in the direction we want to go ... we must continually ask ourselves  "What will happen if ... ?" or better still  "How can we make it happen?"
data.author: Lisa Taylor

data.quote: One must change one's tactics every ten years if one wishes to maintain one's superiority.
data.author: Napoleon Bonaparte

data.quote: New things cannot come where there is no room.
data.author: Mario Morgan

data.quote: The important thing is this: to be able at any moment to sacrifice what we are for what we could become.
data.author: Charles Du Bos

data.quote: When patterns are broken  new worlds emerge.
data.author: Tuli Kupferberg

data.quote: One must lose one's life in order to find it.
data.author: Anne Morrow Lindbergh

data.quote: This Mouse must give up one of his Mouse ways of seeing things in order that he may grow.
data.author: Hyemeyohsts Storm

data.quote: Compromise  if not the spice of life  is its solidity.
data.author: Phyllis McGinley

data.quote: The only alternative to war is peace and the only road to peace is negotiations.
data.author: Golda Meir

data.quote: Every one should keep a mental wastepaper basket and the older he grows the more things he will consign to it-torn up to irrecoverable tatters.
data.author: Samuel Butler

data.quote: Unless one says goodbye to what one loves  and unless one travels to completely new territories  one can expect merely a long wearing away of oneself and an eventual extinction.
data.author: Jean Dubuffet

data.quote: "How does one become a butterfly?" she asked pensively. "You must want to fly so much that you are willing to give up being a caterpillar."
data.author: Trina Paulus

data.quote: No matter how far you have gone on a wrong road  turn back.
data.author: Turkish proverb

data.quote: Duration is not a test of true or false.
data.author: Anne Morrow Lindbergh

data.quote: It is only an error in judgement to make a mistake  but it shows infirmity of character to adhere to it when discovered.
data.author: Christian Bovee

data.quote: If you board the wrong train  it is no use running along the corridor in the other direction.
data.author: Dietrich Bonhoeffer

data.quote: It's never too late-in fiction or in life-to revise.
data.author: Nancy Thayer

data.quote: Any path is only a path  and there is no affront  to oneself or to others  in dropping it if that is what your heart tells you.
data.author: Carlos Castaneda

data.quote: There is a time for departure even when there's no certain place to go.
data.author: Tennessee Williams

data.quote: Being stuck is a position few of us like. We want something new but cannot let go of the old-old ideas  beliefs  habits  even thoughts. We are out of contact with our own genius. Sometimes we know we are stuck  sometimes we don't. In both cases we have to do something.
data.author: Inga Teekens

data.quote: My success was not based so much on any great intelligence but on great common sense.
data.author: Helen Gurley Brown

data.quote: Lose yourself wholly  and the more you lose  the more you will find.
data.author: Saint Catherine of Siena

data.quote: Heroes take journeys  confront dragons  and discover the treasure of their true selves.
data.author: Carol Pearson

data.quote: Life's challenges are not supposed to paralyze you  they're supposed to help you discover who you are.
data.author: Bernice Johnson Reagon

data.quote: Just as we outgrow a pair of trousers  we outgrow acquaintances  libraries  principles  etc.  at times before they're worn out and times-and this is the worst of all-before we have new ones.
data.author: Georg Christoph Lichtenberg

data.quote: It is best to learn as we go  not go as we have learned.
data.author: Leslie Jeanne Sahler

data.quote: Those interested in perpetuating present conditions are always in tears about the marvelous past that is about to disappear  without having so much as a smile for the young future.
data.author: Simone de Beauvoir

data.quote: I will not change just to court popularity.
data.author: Margaret Thatcher

data.quote: Innovation! One cannot be forever innovating. I want to create classics.
data.author: Coco Chanel

data.quote: Have no fear of change as such and  on the other hand  no liking for it merely for its own sake.
data.author: Robert Moses

data.quote: If you want to stand out  don't be different  be outstanding.
data.author: Meredith West

data.quote: The main dangers in this life are the people who want to change everything ... or nothing.
data.author: Lady Astor

data.quote: To change and to improve are two different things.
data.author: German proverb

data.quote: Our fathers valued change for the sake of its results  we value it in the act.
data.author: Alice Meynell

data.quote: We must beware of needless innovations  especially when guided by logic.
data.author: Winston Churchill

data.quote: All change is not growth  as all movement is not forward.
data.author: Ellen Glasgow

data.quote: Just because everything is different doesn't mean anything has changed.
data.author: Irene Peter

data.quote: None are happy but by the anticipation of change. The change itself is nothing  when we have made it  the next wish is to change again.
data.author: Samuel Johnson

data.quote: We accept the verdict of the past until the need for change cries out loudly enough to force upon us a choice between the comforts of further inertia and the irksomeness of action.
data.author: Learned Hand

data.quote: To some will come a time when change itself is beauty  if not heaven.
data.author: Edwin Arlington Robinson

data.quote: Today is not yesterday  how can our works and thoughts  if they are always to be the fittest  continue always the same? Change  indeed  is painful  yet ever needful.
data.author: Thomas Carlyle

data.quote: Security can only be achieved through constant change  through discarding old ideas that have outlived their usefulness and adapting others to current facts.
data.author: William O. Douglas

data.quote: You had better be ready to change your mind when needed.
data.author: Henry B. Wilson

data.quote: Loyalty to petrified opinion never yet broke a chain or freed a human soul.
data.author: Mark Twain

data.quote: They were so strong in their beliefs that there came a time when it hardly mattered what exactly those beliefs were  they all fused into a single stubbornness.
data.author: Louise Erdrich

data.quote: We are chameleons  and our partialities and prejudices change place with an easy and blessed facility.
data.author: Mark Twain

data.quote: Our firmest convictions are apt to be the most suspect  they mark our limitations and our bounds. Life is a petty thing unless it is moved by the indomitable urge to extend its boundaries.
data.author: Jose Ortega y Gasset

data.quote: It often takes more courage to change one's opinion than to stick to it.
data.author: Georg Christoph Lichtenberg

data.quote: All our final resolutions are made in a state of mind which is not going to last.
data.author: Marcel Proust

data.quote: It's an ill plan that cannot be changed.
data.author: Latin proverb

data.quote: The death of dogma is the birth of reality.
data.author: Immanuel Kant

data.quote: If anyone accuses me of contradicting myself  I reply: Because I have been wrong once  or oftener  I do not aspire to be always wrong.
data.author: Vauvenargues

data.quote: He who cannot change the very fabric of his thought will never be able to change reality.
data.author: Anwar Sadat

data.quote: It is in the uncompromisingness with which dogma is held  and not in the dogma or want of dogma  that the danger lies.
data.author: Samuel Butler

data.quote: I wish to say what I think and feel today  with the proviso that tomorrow perhaps I shall contradict it all.
data.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

data.quote: Progress is impossible without change  and those who cannot change their minds cannot change anything.
data.author: George Bernard Shaw

data.quote: The most significant change in a person's life is a change of attitude. Right attitudes produce right actions.
data.author: William J. Johnston

data.quote: You had better be ready to change your mind when needed  or your mind will change you.
data.author: Henry B. Wilson

data.quote: The most fatal illusion is the settled point of view. Since life is growth and motion  a fixed point of view kills anybody who has one.
data.author: Brooks Atkinson

data.quote: The world does not have to change.... The only thing that has to change is our attitude.
data.author: Gerald Jampolsky

data.quote: Oh  would that my mind could let fall its dead ideas  as the tree does its withered leaves!
data.author: Andre Gide

data.quote: Convictions are more dangerous enemies of truth than lies.
data.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

data.quote: A foolish consistency is the hobgoblin of little minds  adored by little statesmen and philosophers and divines.
data.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

data.quote: A man should never be ashamed to own that he has been in the wrong  which is but saying ... that he is wiser today than yesterday.
data.author: Jonathan Swift

data.quote: We have to live today by what truth we can get today and be ready tomorrow to call it falsehood.
data.author: William James

data.quote: It is well for people who think to change their minds occasionally in order to keep them clean. For those who do not think  it is best at least to rearrange their prejudices once in a while.
data.author: Luther Burbank

data.quote: New opinions are always suspected  and usually opposed  without any other reason but because they are not already common.
data.author: John Locke

data.quote: Do I contradict myself? Very well then  I contradict myself (I am large  I contain multitudes).
data.author: Walt Whitman

data.quote: I shall try to correct errors when shown to be errors  and I shall adopt new views so fast as they shall appear to be new views.
data.author: Abraham Lincoln

data.quote: Contradiction is not a sign of falsity  nor the lack of contradiction a sign of truth.
data.author: Blaise Pascal

data.quote: My opinion is a view I hold until... well  until I find something that changes it.
data.author: Luigi Pirandello

data.quote: He that never changes his opinions  and never corrects his mistakes  will never be wiser on the morrow than he is today.
data.author: Tyron Edwards

data.quote: Inconsistency is the only thing in which men are consistent.
data.author: Horatio Smith

data.quote: There is nothing in this world constant but inconstancy.
data.author: Jonathan Swift

data.quote: Consistency is only suitable for ridicule.
data.author: Moliere

data.quote: The world is quite right. It does not have to be consistent.
data.author: Charlotte P. Gilman

data.quote: The world's a scene of changes  and to be constant  in nature  is inconstancy.
data.author: Abraham Cowley

data.quote: We cannot remain consistent with the world save by growing inconsistent with our past selves.
data.author: Havelock Ellis

data.quote: Consistency is the last refuge of the unimaginative.
data.author: Oscar Wilde

data.quote: The world is quite right. It does not have to be consistent.
data.author: Charlotte P. Gilman

data.quote: True consistency  that of the prudent and the wise  is to act in conformity with circumstances  and not to act always the same way under a change of circumstances.
data.author: John C. Calhoun

data.quote: Consistency is a paste jewel that only cheap men cherish.
data.author: William Allen White

data.quote: Consistency requires you to be as ignorant today as you were a year ago.
data.author: Bernard Berenson

data.quote: Consistency is contrary to nature  contrary to life. The only completely consistent people are the dead.
data.author: Aldous Huxley

data.quote: There are those who would misteach us that to stick in a rut is consistency  and a virtue  and that to climb out of the rut is inconsistency  and a vice.
data.author: Mark Twain

data.quote: Too much consistency is as bad for the mind as for the body.
data.author: Aldous Huxley

data.quote: With consistency a great soul has simply nothing to do. ... Speak what you think today in words as hard as cannon balls  and tomorrow speak what tomorrow thinks in hard words again  though it contradicts everything you said today.
data.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

data.quote: People who honestly mean to be true really contradict themselves much more rarely than those who try to be "consistent."
data.author: Oliver Wendell Holmes

data.quote: To be honest  one must be inconsistent.
data.author: H. G. Wells

data.quote: The only man who can't change his mind is a man who hasn't got one.
data.author: Edward Noyes Westcott

data.quote: Like all weak men  he laid an exaggerated stress on not changing one's mind.
data.author: W. Somerset Maugham

data.quote: Nothing should be permanent except struggle with the dark side within ourselves.
data.author: Shirley MacLaine

data.quote: The foolish and the dead alone never change their opinion.
data.author: James Russell Lowell

data.quote: A fanatic is one who can't change his mind and won't change the subject.
data.author: Winston Churchill

data.quote: The circumstances of the world are so variable that an irrevocable purpose or opinion is almost synonymous with a foolish one.
data.author: William H. Seward

data.quote: If in the last few years you haven't discarded a major opinion or acquired a new one  check your pulse. You may be dead.
data.author: Gelett Burgess

data.quote: A stiff attitude is one of the phenomena of rigor mortis.
data.author: Henry S. Haskins

data.quote: Those who never retract their opinions love themselves more than they love truth.
data.author: Joseph Joubert

data.quote: It's the most unhappy people who most fear change.
data.author: Mignon McLaughlin

data.quote: Obstinacy and heat in sticking to one's opinions is the surest proof of stupidity. Is there anything so cocksure  so immovable  so disdainful  so contemplative  so solemn and serious as an ass?
data.author: Michel de Montaigne

data.quote: The man who never alters his opinion is like standing water  and breeds reptiles of the mind.
data.author: William Blake

data.quote: When people are least sure  they are often most dogmatic.
data.author: John Kenneth Galbraith

data.quote: A conclusion is a place where you got tired of thinking.
data.author: Fischer's Law

data.quote: Only fools and dead men don't change their minds. Fools won't. Dead men can't.
data.author: John H. Patterson

data.quote: The consistent thinker ... is either a walking mummy or else  if he has not succeeded in stifling all his vitality  a fanatical monomaniac.
data.author: Aldous Huxley

data.quote: Life is not a static thing. The only people who do not change their minds are incompetents in asylums  and those in cemeteries.
data.author: Everett M. Dirksen

data.quote: To hold the same views at forty as we held at twenty is to have been stupefied for a score of years and to take rank  not as a prophet  but as an unteachable brat  well birched and none the wiser.
data.author: Robert Louis Stevenson

data.quote: To do things today exactly the way you did them yesterday saves thinking.
data.author: Woodrow Wilson

data.quote: Any change  even a change for the better  is always accompanied by drawbacks and discomforts.
data.author: Arnold Bennett

data.quote: Old habits are strong and jealous.
data.author: Dorothea Brande

data.quote: Every new adjustment is a crisis in self-esteem.
data.author: Eric Hoffer

data.quote: Every new truth begins in a shocking heresy.
data.author: Margaret Deland

data.quote: Birth is violent  whether it be the birth of a child or the birth of an idea.
data.author: Marianne Williamson

data.quote: Any truth creates a scandal.
data.author: Marguerite Yourcenar

data.quote: Even in slight things the experience of the new is rarely without some stirring of foreboding.
data.author: Eric Hoffer

data.quote: Change is not made without inconvenience  even from worse to better.
data.author: Richard Hooker

data.quote: All changes  even the most longed for  have their melancholy  for what we leave behind us is a part of ourselves  we must die to one life before we can enter into another.
data.author: Anatole France

data.quote: The key to change ... is to let go of fear.
data.author: Rosanne Cash

data.quote: Tears are sometimes an inappropriate response to death. When a life has been lived completely honestly  completely successfully  or just completely  the correct response to death's perfect punctuation mark is a smile.
data.author: Julie Burchill

data.quote: Since changes are going on anyway  the great thing is to learn enough about them so that we will be able to lay hold of them and turn them in the direction of our desires. Condi-tions and events are neither to be fled from nor passively acquiesced in  they are to be utilized and directed.
data.author: John Dewey

data.quote: He that has energy enough to root out a vice should go further  and try to plant a virtue in its place.
data.author: Charles Caleb Colton

data.quote: To change skins  evolve into new cycles  I feel one has to learn to discard. If one changes internally  one should not continue to live with the same objects. They reflect one's mind and psyche of yesterday. I throw away what has no dynamic  living use.
data.author: Anais Nin

data.quote: Today changes must come fast  and we must adjust our mental habits  so that we can accept comfortably the idea of stopping one thing and beginning another overnight.... We must assume that there is probably a better way to do almost everything. We must stop assuming that a thing which has never been done before probably cannot be done at all.
data.author: Donald M. Nelson

data.quote: We must therefore take account of this changeable nature of things and of human institutions  and prepare for them with enlightened foresight.
data.author: Pope Pius XI

data.quote: You don't have to be afraid of change. You don't have to worry about what's being taken away. Just look to see what's been added.
data.author: Jackie Greer

data.quote: When you're stuck in a spiral  to change all aspects of the spin you need only to change one thing.
data.author: Christina Baldwin

data.quote: The first step toward change is acceptance. Once you accept yourself  you open the door to change. That's all you have to do. Change is not something you do  it's something you allow.
data.author: Will Garcia

data.quote: The more things change  the more they remain the same.
data.author: Alphonse Karr

data.quote: Things good in themselves ... perfectly valid in the integrity of their origins  become fetters if they cannot alter.
data.author: Freya Stark

data.quote: Change lays her hand not upon the truth.
data.author: Algernon Swinburne

data.quote: The spectacle has changed  but our eyes remain the same.
data.author: Joseph Joubert

data.quote: Change is the constant  the signal for rebirth  the egg of the phoenix.
data.author: Christina Baldwin

data.quote: Change is what people fear most.
data.author: Fyodor Dostoyevsky

data.quote: Change means the unknown.
data.author: Eleanor Roosevelt

data.quote: Nature's mighty law is change.
data.author: Robert Burns

data.quote: A human being does not cease to exist at death. It is change  not destruction  which takes place.
data.author: Florence Nightingale

data.quote: The old order changeth yielding place to new  and God fulfills himself in many ways.
data.author: Alfred, Lord Tennyson

data.quote: The only people in the world who can change things are those who can sell ideas.
data.author: Lois Wyse

data.quote: Everybody thinks of changing humanity and nobody thinks of changing himself.
data.author: Leo Tolstoy

data.quote: One person's constant is another person's variable.
data.author: Susan Gerhart

data.quote: The mill wheel turns  it turns forever  though what is uppermost remains not so.
data.author: Bertolt Brecht

data.quote: It's a bad plan that can't be changed.
data.author: Publilius Syrus

data.quote: In a way  winter is the real spring  the time when the inner things happen  the resurge of nature.
data.author: Edna O'Brien

data.quote: Mourning is not forgetting. ... It is an undoing. Every minute tie has to be untied and something permanent and valuable recovered and assimilated from the dust.
data.author: Margery Allingham

data.quote: It is never any good dwelling on goodbyes. It is not the being together that it prolongs  it is the parting.
data.author: Elizabeth Asquith Bibesco

data.quote: Such is the state of life that none are happy but by the anticipation of change. The change itself is nothing. When we have made it  the next wish is to change again.
data.author: Samuel Johnson

data.quote: New links must be forged as old ones rust.
data.author: Jane Howard

data.quote: The hearts of great men can be changed.
data.author: Homer

data.quote: You cannot step twice into the same river  for other waters are continually flowing on.
data.author: Heraclitus

data.quote: A man's fortune must first be changed from within.
data.author: Chinese proverb

data.quote: One change always leaves the way open for the establishment of others.
data.author: Niccolo Machiavelli

data.quote: There is danger in reckless change  but greater danger in blind conservatism.
data.author: Henry George

data.quote: Without imagination  nothing is dangerous.
data.author: Georgette Leblanc

data.quote: Everything in life that we really accept undergoes a change.
data.author: Katherine Mansfield

data.quote: The moment of change is the only poem.
data.author: Adrienne Rich

data.quote: I have accepted fear as a part of life-specifically the fear of change. ... I have gone ahead despite the pounding in the heart that says: turn back. ...
data.author: Erica Jong

data.quote: As we learn we always change  and so our perception. This changed perception then becomes a new Teacher inside each of us.
data.author: Hyemeyohsts Storm

data.quote: We are restless because of incessant change  but we would be frightened if change were stopped.
data.author: Lyman Lloyd Bryson

data.quote: One must be thrust out of a finished cycle in life  and that leap is the most difficult to make-to part with one's faith  one's love  when one would prefer to renew the faith and recreate the passion.
data.author: Anais Nin

data.quote: When one door of happiness closes  another opens  but often we look so long at the closed door that we do not see the one which has been opened for us.
data.author: Helen Keller

data.quote: If you want to make enemies  try to change something.
data.author: Woodrow Wilson

data.quote: God  grant me the serenity to accept the things I cannot change  the courage to change the things I can  and the wisdom to know the difference.
data.author: Reinhold Niebuhr

data.quote: Whenever man comes up with a better mousetrap  nature immediately comes up with a better mouse.
data.author: James Carswell

data.quote: Musical comedies aren't written  they are re-written.
data.author: Stephen Sondheim

data.quote: I see the playwright as a lay preacher peddling the ideas of his time in popular form.
data.author: August Strindberg

data.quote: The art of creation is older than the art of killing.
data.author: Andrei Voznesensky

data.quote: Human Salvation lies in the hands of the creatively maladjusted.
data.author: Martin Luther King, Jr.

data.quote: In the creative state a man is taken out of himself. He lets down as it were a bucket into his subconscious  and draws up something which is normally beyond his reach. He mixes this thing with his normal experiences and out of the mixture he makes a work of art.
data.author: E. M. Forster

data.quote: I do not seek. I find.
data.author: Pablo Picasso

data.quote: The creation of a thousand forests is in one acorn.
data.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

data.quote: The life of the creative man is led  directed and controlled by boredom. Avoiding boredom is one of our most important purposes.
data.author: Saul Steinberg

data.quote: An artist is a creature driven by demons. He doesn't know why they choose him and he's usually too busy to wonder why.
data.author: William Faulkner

data.quote: No artist is ahead of his time. He is his time. It is just that others are behind the time.
data.author: Martha Graham

data.quote: Doodling is the brooding of the hand.
data.author: Saul Steinberg

data.quote: I am a choreographer. A choreographer is a poet. I do not create. God creates. I assemble  and I will steal from everywhere to do it.
data.author: George Balanchine

data.quote: Workaholics are energized rather than enervated by their work - their energy paradoxically expands as it is expended.
data.author: Marilyn Machlowitz

data.quote: You lose it if you talk about it.
data.author: Ernest Hemingway

data.quote: In creating  the only hard thing's to begin  A grass-blade's no easier to make than an oak.
data.author: James Russell Lowell

data.quote: I can always be distracted by love  but eventually I get horny for my creativity.
data.author: Gilda Radner

data.quote: The End of every maker is himself.
data.author: St. Thomas Aquinas
