data.quote: Now I really make the little idea from clay  and I hold it in my hand. I can turn it  look at it from underneath  see it from one view  hold it against the sky  imagine it any size I like  and really be in control  almost like God creating something.
data.author: Henry Moore

data.quote: No matter how old you get  if you can keep the desire to be creative  you're keeping the man-child alive.
data.author: John Cassavetes

data.quote: What is originality? Undetected plagiarism.
data.author: Dean William R. Inge

data.quote: Originality is nothing but judicious imitation.
data.author: Voltaire

data.quote: A hunch is creativity trying to tell you something.
data.author: Frank Capra

data.quote: Style is a simple way of saying complicated things.
data.author: Jean Cocteau

data.quote: What another would have done as well as you  do not do it. What another would have said as well as you  do not say it. What another would have written as well  do not write it. Be faithful to that which exists nowhere but in yourself- and thus make yourself indispensable.
data.author: Andre Gide

data.quote: It seems that the creative faculty and the critical faculty cannot exist together in their highest perfection.
data.author: Thomas Babington Macaulay

data.quote: I must create a system or be enslaved by another man's. I will not reason and compare  My business is to create.
data.author: William Blake

data.quote: In the beginning God created the Heaven and the earth. And the earth was without form  and void  and darkness was upon the face of the deep. And the Spirit of God moved upon the face of the waters. And God said  Let there be light  and there was light.
data.author: Bible

data.quote: Nature they say  doth dote  And cannot make a man Save on some worn-out plan  Repeating us by rote.
data.author: James Russell Lowell

data.quote: All are but parts of one stupendous whole  Whose body Nature is  and God the soul.
data.author: Alexander Pope

data.quote: It is easier to suppose that the universe has existed from all eternity than to conceive a Being beyond its limits capable of creating it.
data.author: Percy Bysshe Shelley

data.quote: The world embarrasses me  and I cannot dream That this watch exists and has no watchmaker.
data.author: Voltaire

data.quote: God is in the world  or nowhere  creating continually in us and around us. Insofar as man partakes of this creative process does he partake of the divine  of God  and that participation is his immortality ....
data.author: Alfred North Whitehead

data.quote: You were placed on this earth to create  not to compete.
data.author: Robert Anthony

data.quote: Every moment of your life is infinitely creative and the universe is endlessly bountiful. )ust put forth a clear enough request  and everything your heart truly desires must come to you.
data.author: Shakti Gawain

data.quote: There is no greater joy than that of feeling oneself a creator. The triumph of life is expressed by creation.
data.author: Henri Bergson

data.quote: Creativity is a central source of meaning in our lives . . . most of the things that are interesting  important  and human are the results of creativity . . . when we are involved in it  we feel that we are living more fully than during the rest of life.
data.author: Mihaly Csikszentmihalyi

data.quote: Creativeness often consists of merely turning up what is already there.
data.author: Bernice Fitz-Gibbon

data.quote: A hunch is creativity trying to tell you something.
data.author: Frank Capra

data.quote: I saw an angel in the block of marble and I just chiseled 'til I set him free.
data.author: Michelangelo

data.quote: In creating  the only hard thing's to begin  A grass-blade's no easier to make than an oak.
data.author: James Russell Lowell

data.quote: No matter how old you get  if you can keep the desire to be creative  you're keeping the man-child alive.
data.author: John Cassavetes

data.quote: It is the child in man that is the source of his uniqueness and creativeness  and the playground is the optimal milieu for the unfolding of his capacities.
data.author: Eric Hoffer

data.quote: Many times we will get more ideas and better ideas in two hours of creative loafing than in eight hours at a desk.
data.author: Wilfred Peterson

data.quote: If you are seeking creative ideas  go out walking. Angels whisper to a man when he goes for a walk.
data.author: Raymond Inman

data.quote: In God we trust  all others must pay cash.
data.author: American Saying

data.quote: He that hath lost his credit is dead to the world.
data.author: George Edward Herbert

data.quote: No man's credit is as good as his money.
data.author: E. W. Howe

data.quote: Ah  take the cash  and let the credit go.
data.author: Omar Khayyam

data.quote: Better be too credulous than too skeptical
data.author: Chinese proverb

data.quote: Let us believe neither half of the good people tell us of ourselves  nor half the evil they say of others.
data.author: J. Pettit-Senn

data.quote: I wish I was as sure of anything as Macaulay is of everything.
data.author: William Windham

data.quote: A small demerit extinguishes a long service.
data.author: Thomas Fuller

data.quote: And the thing has been said and said well  have no scruple. Take it and copy it.
data.author: Anatole France

data.quote: Jupiter is slow looking into his notebook  but he always looks.
data.author: Zenobius

data.quote: The number of malefactors authorizes not the crime.
data.author: Thomas Fuller

data.quote: No one is entirely useless. Even the worst of us can serve as horrible examples.
data.author: Anonymous prisoner

data.quote: The faults of the burglar are the qualities of the financier.
data.author: George Bernard Shaw

data.quote: He who excuses himself accuses himself. (Qui s'excuse  s'accuse.)
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: The study of crime begins with the knowledge of oneself.
data.author: Henry Miller

data.quote: Fear succeeds crime - it is its punishment.
data.author: Voltaire

data.quote: All punishment is mischief. All punishment in itself is evil.
data.author: Jeremy Bentham

data.quote: Speaking generally  punishment hardens and numbs  it produces concentration  it sharpens the consciousness of alienation  it strengthens the power of resistance.
data.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

data.quote: He only may chastise who loves.
data.author: Rabindranath Tagore

data.quote: If England treats her criminals the way she has treated me  she doesn't deserve to have any.
data.author: Oscar Wilde

data.quote: It is fairly obvious that those who are in favour of the death penalty have more affinity with assassins than those who are not.
data.author: Remy de Gourmont

data.quote: Prisons don't rehabilitate  they don't punish  they don't protect  so what the hell do they do?
data.author: Jerry Brown

data.quote: Capital punishment is as fundamentally wrong as a cure for crime as charity is wrong as a cure for poverty.
data.author: Henry Ford

data.quote: The reformative effect of punishment is a belief that dies hard  chiefly  I think  because it is so satisfying to our sadistic impulses.
data.author: Bertrand Russell

data.quote: Much as he is opposed to lawbreaking  he is not bigoted about it.
data.author: Damon Runyon

data.quote: Crime  like virtue  has its degrees.
data.author: Racine

data.quote: Society prepares the crime  the criminal commits it.
data.author: Henry Thomas Buckle

data.quote: Many commit the same crimes with a very different result. One bears a cross for his crime  another a crown.
data.author: Juvenal

data.quote: One crime is everything  two nothing.
data.author: Dorothee Deluzy

data.quote: Whoever profits by the crime is guilty of it.
data.author: French proverb

data.quote: It is not the thief who is hanged  but one who was caught stealing.
data.author: Czech proverb

data.quote: We enact many laws that manufacture criminals  and then a few that punish them.
data.author: Abraham Tucker

data.quote: Yet each man kills the thing he loves  By each let this be heard  Some do it with a bitter look  Some with a flattering word  The coward does it with a kiss  The brave man with a sword.
data.author: Oscar Wilde

data.quote: When written in Chinese  the word crisis is composed of two characters. One represents danger and the other represents opportunity.
data.author: John F. Kennedy

data.quote: Any idiot can face a crisis - it's this day-to-day living that wears you out.
data.author: Anton Chekhov

data.quote: Every new adjustment is a crisis in self-esteem.
data.author: Eric Hoffer

data.quote: Winston has written four volumes about himself and called it 'World Crisis'.
data.author: Arthur Balfour

data.quote: Poetry is the language of a state of crisis.
data.author: Stephane Mallarme

data.quote: There cannot be a crisis next week. My schedule is already full.
data.author: Henry Kissinger

data.quote: There is no crisis to which academics will not respond with a seminar.
data.author: Old saying

data.quote: Faced with crisis  the man of character falls back on himself.
data.author: Charles de Gaulle

data.quote: The crisis of today is the joke of tomorrow.
data.author: H. G. Wells

data.quote: The crisis you have to worry about most is the one you don't see coming.
data.author: Mike Mansfield

data.quote: So when the crisis is upon you  remember that God  like a trainer of wrestlers  has matched you with a tough and stalwart antagonist... that you may prove a victor at the Great Games.
data.author: Epictetus

data.quote: Said the pot to die kettle  "Get away  blackface."
data.author: Miguel de Cervantes

data.quote: Critics are the men who have failed in literature and art.
data.author: Benjamin Disraeli

data.quote: As a bankrupt thief turns thief-taker in despair  so an unsuccessful author turns critic.
data.author: Percy Bysshe Shelley

data.quote: What a blessed thing it is that nature  when she invented  manufactured and patented her audiors  contrived to make critics out of the chips that were left!
data.author: Oliver Wendell Holmes

data.quote: Even the lion has to defend himself against flies.
data.author: German proverb

data.quote: I had rather be hissed for a good verse than applauded for a bad one.
data.author: Victor Hugo

data.quote: Of all the cants which are canted in this canting world -  though the cant of hypocrites ihay be the worst - the cant of criticism is the most tormenting.
data.author: Laurence Sterne

data.quote: A guest sees more in an hour than the host in a year.
data.author: Polish proverb

data.quote: Asking a working writer what he thinks about critics is like asking a lamppost how it feels about dogs.
data.author: Christopher Hampton

data.quote: Book reviewers are little old ladies of both sexes.
data.author: John O'Hara

data.quote: Constant  indiscriminate approval devalues because it is so predictable.
data.author: Kit Reed

data.quote: Critics are biased  and so are readers. (Indeed  a critic is a bundle of biases held loosely together by a sense of taste.) But intelligent readers soon discover how to allow for the windage of their own and a critic's prejudices.
data.author: Whitney Balliett

data.quote: Don't judge any man until you have walked two moons in his moccasins.
data.author: American Indian saying

data.quote: Henry James chews more than he bites off.
data.author: Mrs. Henry Adams

data.quote: I don't want to see the uncut version of anything.
data.author: Jean Kerr

data.quote: It is easy - terribly easy - to shake a man's faith in himself. To take advantage of that  to break a man's spirit is devil's work.
data.author: George Bernard Shaw

data.quote: The critic is an overgoer with pen-envy.
data.author: Geoffrey Hartman

data.quote: Two and two continue to make four  in spite of the whine of the amateur for three  or the cry of the critic for five.
data.author: James McNeill Whistler

data.quote: Tomorrow night I appear for the first time before a Boston audience - 4000 critics.
data.author: Mark Twain

data.quote: He has a right to criticize  who has a heart to help.
data.author: Abraham Lincoln

data.quote: More and more people think of the critic as an indispensable middle man between writer and reader  and would no more read a book alone  if they could help it  than have a baby alone.
data.author: Randall Jarrell

data.quote: It is not expected of critics that they should help us to make sense of our lives  they are bound only to attempt the lesser feat of making sense of the ways we try to make sense of our lives.
data.author: Frank Kermode

data.quote: Analysis kills spontaneity. The grain once ground into flour springs and germinates no more.
data.author: Henri Frederic Amiel

data.quote: His words leap across rivers and mountains  but his thoughts are still only six inches long.
data.author: E. B. White

data.quote: When critics disagree  the artist is in accord with himself.
data.author: Oscar Wilde

data.quote: The factor in human life provocative of a noble discontent is the gradual emergence of a sense of criticism  founded upon appreciation of beauty  and of intellectual distinction  and of duty.
data.author: Alfred North Whitehead

data.quote: To many people dramatic criticism must seem like an attempt to tattoo soap bubbles.
data.author: John Mason Brown

data.quote: The test of a good critic is whether he knows when and how to believe on insufficient evidence.
data.author: Samuel Butler

data.quote: Reprove not a scorner  lest he hate thee  rebuke a wise man and he will love thee.
data.author: Bible

data.quote: In judging others  folks will work overtime for no pay.
data.author: Charles Edwin Carruthers

data.quote: A critic is a man who knows the way but can't drive the car.
data.author: Kenneth Tynan

data.quote: If you are willing to take the punishment  you're halfway through the battle. That the issues may be trivial  the battle ugly  is another point.
data.author: Lillian Hellman

data.quote: A critic is a legless man who teaches running.
data.author: Channing Pollock

data.quote: Vilify! Vilify! Some of it will always stick.
data.author: Pierre Beaumarchais

data.quote: Always bring money along with your complaints.
data.author: Plautus

data.quote: Nature fits all her children with something to do He who would write and can't write  can surely review.
data.author: James Russell Lowell

data.quote: Nature  when she invented  manufactured and patented her authors  contrived to make critics out of the chips that were left.
data.author: Oliver Wendell Holmes

data.quote: To escape criticism - do nothing  say nothing  be nothing.
data.author: Elbert Hubbard

data.quote: Any fool can criticize  and many of them do.
data.author: Archbishop C. Garbett

data.quote: Critics are like eunuchs in a harem: they know how it's done  they've seen it done every day  but they're unable to do it themselves.
data.author: Brendan Behan

data.quote: I am sitting in the smallest room in my house. I have your review in front of me. Soon it will be behind me.
data.author: Max Reger

data.quote: The good critic is he who narrates the adventures of his soul among masterpieces.
data.author: Anatole France

data.quote: Of all the cants which are canted in this canting world  tho' the cant of hypocrites may be the worst  the cant of criticism is the most tormenting.
data.author: Laurence Sterne

data.quote: The critic is the duenna in the passionate affair between playwrights  actors and audiences - a figure dreaded  and occasionally comic  but never welcome  never loved.
data.author: Robertson Davies

data.quote: A critic at best is a waiter at the great table of literature.
data.author: Louis Dudek

data.quote: In Heaven an angel is nobody in particular.
data.author: George Bernard Shaw

data.quote: The mob has many heads but no brains.
data.author: Thomas Fuller

data.quote: A myth is a fixed way of looking at the world which cannot be destroyed because  looked at through the myth  all evidence supports that myth.
data.author: Edward de Bono

data.quote: Insanity in individuals is rare - but in groups  parties  nations  and epochs  it is the rule.
data.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

data.quote: Every crowd has a silver lining.
data.author: P. T. Barnum

data.quote: When a hundred men stand together  each of them loses his mind and gets another one.
data.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

data.quote: Wherever there is a crowd there is untruth.
data.author: Soren Kierkegaard

data.quote: The time when  most of all  you should withdraw into yourself is when you are forced to be in a crowd.
data.author: Epicurus

data.quote: You cannot make a man by standing a sheep on its hind legs. But by standing a flock of sheep in that position you can make a crowd of men.
data.author: Max Beerbohm

data.quote: The average man's opinions are much less foolish than they would be if he thought for himself.
data.author: Bertrand Russell

data.quote: Man's inhumanity to man Makes countless thousands mourn!
data.author: James Drummond Burns

data.quote: It is not linen you're wearing out  But human creatures' lives.
data.author: Thomas Hood

data.quote: All cruelty springs from weakness.
data.author: Seneca

data.quote: I must be cruel  only to be kind.
data.author: William Shakespeare

data.quote: Culture  with us  ends in headache.
data.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

data.quote: Reading makes a full man  conference a ready man  and writing an exact man.
data.author: Sir Francis Bacon

data.quote: Culture is what your butcher would have if he were a surgeon.
data.author: Mary Pettibone Poole

data.quote: Curiosity killed the cat.
data.author: American Proverb

data.quote: Ask me no questions  and I'll tell you no fibs.
data.author: Oliver Goldsmith

data.quote: Curiosity is one of the permanent and certain characteristics of a vigorous intellect.
data.author: Samuel Johnson

data.quote: Other times  other customs.
data.author: Italian proverb

data.quote: Ancient custom has the force of law.
data.author: Legal maxim

data.quote: Custom is the law of fools.
data.author: Sir John Vanbrugh

data.quote: A cynic is not merely one who reads bitter lessons from the past  he is one who is prematurely disappointed in the future.
data.author: Sidney J. Harris

data.quote: Cynicism is humour in ill health.
data.author: H. G. Wells

data.quote: Cynicism such as one finds very frequently among the most highly educated young men and women of the West  results from the combination of comfort and powerlessness.
data.author: Bertrand Russell

data.quote: A cynic is a man who  when he smells flowers  looks around for a coffin.
data.author: H. L. Mencken

data.quote: Cynicism - the intellectual cripple's substitute for intelligence.
data.author: Russell Lynes

data.quote: Cynicism is that blackguard defect of vision which compels us to see the world as it is  instead of as it should be.
data.author: Ambrose Bierce

data.quote: Cynicism is intellectual dandyism  without the coxcomb's feathers.
data.author: George Meredith

data.quote: There is nothing to which men  while they have food and drink  cannot reconcile themselves.
data.author: George Santayana

data.quote: It's not that the Irish are cynical. It's rather that they have a wonderful lack of respect for everything and everybody.
data.author: Brendan Behan

data.quote: Watch what people are cynical about  and one can often discover what they lack.
data.author: Harry Emerson Fosdick

data.quote: What is a cynic? A man who knows the price of everything and the value of nothing.
data.author: Oscar Wilde

data.quote: A cynic can chill and dishearten with a single word.
data.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

data.quote: We can destroy ourselves by cynicism and disillusion just as effectively as by bombs.
data.author: Kenneth Clark

data.quote: Cynicism is an unpleasant way of saying the truth.
data.author: Lillian Hellman

data.quote: A cynic is a man who knows the price of everything  and the value of nothing.
data.author: Oscar Wilde

data.quote: The cynic is one who never sees a good quality in a man  and never fails to see a bad one. He is the human owl  vigilant in darkness and blind to light  mousing for vermin  and never seeing noble game. The cynic puts all human actions into two classes - openly bad and secretly bad.
data.author: Henry Ward Beecher

data.quote: On with the dance! Let joy be unconfin'd  No sleep till morn  when Youth and Pleasure meet.
data.author: Lord Byron

data.quote: No man in his senses will dance.
data.author: Cicero

data.quote: Come and trip it as ye go  On the light fantastic toe.
data.author: John Milton

data.quote: They who love dancing too much seem to have more brains in their feet than in their head.
data.author: Terence

data.quote: We triumph without glory when we conquer without danger.
data.author: Corneille

data.quote: Danger for danger's sake is senseless.
data.author: Leigh Hunt

data.quote: The pitcher that goes too often to the well is broken at last.
data.author: Enclish Proverb

data.quote: A timid person is frightened before a danger  a coward during the time  and a courageous person afterwards.
data.author: Jean Paul Richter

data.quote: Who dares nothing  need hope for nothing.
data.author: Friedrich von Schiller

data.quote: No one reaches a high position without daring.
data.author: Syrus

data.quote: When it is dark enough  you can see the stars.
data.author: Charles A. Beard

data.quote: A blind man in a dark room - looking for a black hat which isn't there.
data.author: Lord Bowen

data.quote: Darkness is strong  and so is Sin  But surely God endures forever!

data.quote: It is always darkest just before .the day dawneth.
data.author: Thomas Fuller

data.quote: My son is my son till he have got him a wife  But my daughter's my daughter all the days of her life.
data.author: Thomas Fuller

data.quote: If thy daughter marry well  thou hast found a son  if not  thou hast lost a daughter.
data.author: Francis Quarles

data.quote: Tis of the tears which stars weep  sweet with joy.
data.author: Francis Bailey

data.quote: Every dew-drop and raindrop had a whole heaven within it.
data.author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

data.quote: Think that day lost whose (low) descending sun Views from thy hand no noble action done.
data.author: Jacob Bobart

data.quote: For mem'ry has painted this perfect day. With colors that never fade  And we find at the end of a perfect day  The soul of a friend we've made
data.author: Carrie Jacobs Bond

data.quote: What a day may bring a day may take away.
data.author: Thomas Fuller

data.quote: Monday for wealth  Tuesday for health  Wednesday the best day of all: Thursday for crosses  Friday for losses  Saturday no luck at all.
data.author: Old English Rhyme

data.quote: One glance of Thine creates a day.
data.author: Isaac Watts

data.quote: Death twitches my ear. "Live " he says  "I am coming".
data.author: Justice Oliver Wendell Holmes

data.quote: To die is a debt we must all of us discharge.
data.author: Euripides

data.quote: Here lies Jack Williams. He done his damndest.
data.author: Harry S. Truman

data.quote: As long as I have a want  I have a reason for living. Satisfaction is death.
data.author: George Bernard Shaw

data.quote: For death begins with life's first breath And life begins at touch of death.
data.author: John Oxenham

data.quote: As men  we are all equal in the presence of death.
data.author: Publilius Syrus

data.quote: At last God caught his eye.
data.author: Harry Secombe

data.quote: Death - the last voyage  the longest  the best.
data.author: Thomas Wolfe

data.quote: Death is a delightful hiding-place for weary men.
data.author: Herodotus

data.quote: Death is just a distant rumour to the young.
data.author: Andy Roomy

data.quote: For three days after death  hair and fingernails continue to grow but phone calls taper off.
data.author: Johnny Carson

data.quote: He mourns the dead who lives as they desire.
data.author: Edward Young

data.quote: He that dies pays all debts.
data.author: William Shakespeare

data.quote: Honest listening is one of the best medicines we can offer the dying and the bereaved.
data.author: Jean Cameron

data.quote: I believe that the struggle against death  the unconditional and self-willed determination to live  is the mode of power behind the lives and activities of all outstanding men.
data.author: Hermann Hesse

data.quote: I care not  a man can die but once  we owe God a death.
data.author: William Shakespeare

data.quote: I had a lover's quarrel with the world.
data.author: Robert Frost

data.quote: In Heaven  all the interesting people are missing.
data.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

data.quote: In Spain  the dead are more alive than the dead of any other country in the world.
data.author: Fedirico Garcia Lorca

data.quote: It is a far  far better thing that I do  than anything I have ever done  it is a far  far  better rest that I go to  than I have ever known.
data.author: Charles Dickens

data.quote: Man comes and tills the field and lies beneath  And after many a summer dieth the swan.
data.author: Alfred Lord Tennyson

data.quote: It may be that we have all lived before and died  and this is Hell.
data.author: A. L. Prusick

data.quote: If there is another world  he lives in bliss. If there is none  he made the best of this.
data.author: Robert Burns

data.quote: Most persons have died before they expired - died to all earthly longings  so that the last breath is only  as it were  the locking of the door of the already deserted mansion.
data.author: Oliver Wendell Holmes

data.quote: One short sleep past will wake eternally And death shall be no more  Death thou shalt die.
data.author: John Donne

data.quote: Rather suffer than die is man's motto.
data.author: Jean de la Fontaine

data.quote: The art of living well and the art of dying well are one.
data.author: Epicurus

data.quote: The only truly dead are those who have been forgotten.
data.author: Jewish saying

data.quote: The question is whether suicide is the way out  or the way in.
data.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

data.quote: When you have told anyone you have left him a legacy  the only decent thing to do is to die at once.
data.author: Samuel Butler

data.quote: I will be dead in a few months. But it hasn't given me the slightest anxiety or worry. I always knew I was going to die.
data.author: B. F. Skinner

data.quote: Do not go gentle into that good night Old age should burn and rave at close of day  Rage  rage against the dying of the light.
data.author: Dylan Thomas

data.quote: The stroke of death is as a lover's pinch  Which hurts and is desired.
data.author: William Shakespeare

data.quote: Nothing in his life Became him like the leaving it.
data.author: William Shakespeare

data.quote: Things have a terrible permanence when people die.
data.author: Joyce Kilmer

data.quote: A solemn funeral is inconceivable to the Chinese mind.
data.author: Lin Yutang

data.quote: At its most basic root  the death or disintegration of one's parents is a harsh reminder of one's own mortality.
data.author: Janet Harris

data.quote: I don't want to achieve immortality through my work. I want to achieve immortality through not dying.
data.author: Woody Allen

data.quote: Mausoleum  n: the final and funniest folly of the rich.
data.author: Ambrose Bierce

data.quote: No  'tis not so deep as a well  nor so wide as a church door  but 'tis enough  'twill serve: ask for me tomorrow  and you shall find me a grave man. I am peppered  I warrant  for this world.
data.author: William Shakespeare

data.quote: Epitaph  n: an inscription on a tomb showing that virtues acquired by death have a retroactive effect.
data.author: Ambrose Bierce

data.quote: Human life consists in mutual service. No grief  pain  misfortune  or 'broken heart' is excuse for cutting off one's life while any power of service remains. But when all usefulness is over  when one is assured of an unavoidable and imminent death  it is the simplest of human rights to choose a quick and easy death in place of a slow and horrible one.
data.author: Charlotte Perkins Gilman

data.quote: Poisons pain you  Rivers are damp  Acid stains you  And drugs cause cramp. Guns aren't lawful  Nooses give  Gas smells awful  You might as well live.
data.author: Dorothy Parker

data.quote: Dying is a wild night and a new road.
data.author: Emily Dickinson

data.quote: The reports of my death are greatly exaggerated.
data.author: Mark Twain

data.quote: And I looked  and behold  a pale horse: and his name that sat on him was Death.
data.author: Bible

data.quote: There is no man so blessed that some who stand by his deathbed won't hail the occasion with delight.
data.author: Marcus Aurelius

data.quote: There may be little or much beyond the grave  But the strong are saying nothing until they see.
data.author: Robert Frost

data.quote: All human things are subject to decay And when fate summons  monarchs must obey.
data.author: John Dryden

data.quote: When Andrew Jackson died someone asked a friend if he thought Old Hickory would go to heaven. 'He will if he wants to ' was the reply. On his death bed Disraeli declined a visit from Queen Victoria. 'No  it is better not'  he said  'she would only ask me to take a message to Albert.' I am a broken machine. I am ready to go.
data.author: Woodrow Wilson

data.quote: Let the tent be struck.
data.author: Robert E. Lee

data.quote: You can lose a man like that by your own death  but not by his.
data.author: George Bernard Shaw

data.quote: Because I could not stop for Death He kindly stopped for me - The carriage held but just ourselves And Immortality.
data.author: Emily Dickinson

data.quote: When a man dies  he does not just die of the disease he has: he dies of his whole life.
data.author: Charles Peguy

data.quote: The long habit of living indisposeth us for dying.
data.author: Thomas Browne

data.quote: Most people would die sooner than think  in fact  they do.
data.author: Bertrand Russell

data.quote: One should be ever booted and spurred and ready to depart.
data.author: Michel de Montaigne

data.quote: Who never caused others to die Seldom rates a statue.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: Nothing you can lose by dying is half so precious as the readiness to die  which is man's charter of nobility.
data.author: George Santayana

data.quote: After sixty years the stern sentence of the burial service seems to have a meaning that one did not notice in former years. There begins to be something personal about it.
data.author: Oliver Wendell Holmes

data.quote: Death be not proud  though some have called Thee Mighty and dreadful  for thou art not so.
data.author: John Donne

data.quote: Toward the person who has died we adopt a special attitude: something like admiration for someone who has accomplished a very difficult task.
data.author: Sigmund Freud

data.quote: You have to learn to do everything  even to die.
data.author: Gertrude Stein

data.quote: I'm not afraid to die. I just don't want to be there when it happens.
data.author: Woody Allen

data.quote: Oh death  you can wait  keep your distance.
data.author: Andre Chenier

data.quote: Body and mind  like man and wife  do not always agree to die together.
data.author: Charles Caleb Colton

data.quote: The undiscovered country from whose bourn no traveller returns.
data.author: William Shakespeare

data.quote: A thousand goodbyes come after death - the first six months of bereavement.
data.author: Alan Gregg

data.quote: You don't die in the United States  you underachieve.
data.author: Jerzy Kosinski

data.quote: Life is a great surprise. I do not see why death should not be an even greater one.
data.author: Vladimir Nabokov

data.quote: If life must not be taken too seriously - then so neither must death.
data.author: Samuel Butler

data.quote: Death is terrible to Cicero  desirable to Cato  and indifferent to Socrates.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: In nature  there is less death and destruction than death and transmutation.
data.author: Edwin Way Teale

data.quote: A man's dying is more the survivors' affair than his own.
data.author: Thomas Mann

data.quote: I hate funerals  and would not attend my Own if it could be avoided  but it is well for every man to stop once in a while to think of what sort of a collection of mourners he is training for his final event.
data.author: Robert T. Morris

data.quote: If this is dying  I don't think much of it.
data.author: Lytton Strachey

data.quote: Men use one another to assure their personal victory over death.
data.author: Ernest Becker

data.quote: Any man's death diminishes me  because I am involved in mankind  and therefore never send to know for whom the bell tolls  it tolls for thee.
data.author: John Donne

data.quote: A belief in hell and the knowledge that every ambition is doomed to frustration at the hands of a skeleton have never prevented the majority of human beings from behaving as though death were no more than an unfounded rumour  and survival a thing not beyond the bounds of possibility.
data.author: Aldous Huxley

data.quote: I cannot forgive my friends for dying: I do not find these vanishing acts of theirs at all amusing.
data.author: Logan Pearsall Smith

data.quote: Make sure to send a lazy man for the Angel of Death.
data.author: Jewish proverb

data.quote: It cost me never a stab nor squirm To tread by chance upon a worm. 'Aha  my little dear' I say  'Your clan will pay me back one day.'
data.author: Dorothy Parker

data.quote: Around  around the sun we go: The moon goes round the earth. We do not die of death: We die of vertigo.
data.author: Archibald MacLeish

data.quote: There is no such thing as death  In nature  nothing dies: From each sad moment of decay Some forms of life arise.
data.author: Charles Mackay

data.quote: I am going to seek a great Perhaps.
data.author: Frangois Rabelais

data.quote: Call no man happy till he is dead.
data.author: Aeschylus

data.quote: Though this may be play to you  Tis death to us.
data.author: Aesop

data.quote: Earth to earth  ashes to ashes  dust to dust  in sure and certain hope of the resurrection.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: In the midst of life we are in death.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: Man that is born of a woman hath but a short time to live  and is full of misery. He cometh up  and is cut down  like a flower  he fleeth as it were a shadow  and never continueth in one stay.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: Death  so called  is a thing which makes men weep  And yet a third of life is pass'd in sleep.
data.author: Lord Byron

data.quote: Why fear death? It is the most beautiful adventure in life.
data.author: Charles Frohman

data.quote: Now I am about to take my last voyage  a great leap in the dark.
data.author: Thomas Hobbes

data.quote: Is death the last sleep? No  it is the last final awakening.
data.author: Walter Scott

data.quote: The Lord gave  and the Lord hath taken away  blessed be the name of the Lord.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: We begin to die as soon as we are born  and the end is linked to the beginning.
data.author: Marcus Manilius

data.quote: There is no death! the stars go down To rise upon some other shore  And bright in Heaven's jeweled crown  They shine for ever more.
data.author: John L. McCreery

data.quote: Strange - is it not? - that of the myriads who Before us passed the door of Darkness through  Not one returns to tell us of the road Which to discover we must travel too.
data.author: Omar Khayyam

data.quote: I am dying  Egypt  dying.
data.author: William Shakespeare

data.quote: Yet a little sleep  a little slumber  a little folding of the hands to sleep.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: I have a rendezvous with Death At some disputed barricade.
data.author: Alan Seecer

data.quote: Till tired  he sleeps  and life's poor play is o'er.
data.author: Alexander Pope

data.quote: To die: - to sleep: No more  and  by a sleep to say we end The heart-ache and the thousand natural shocks That flesh is heir to  'tis a consummation Devoutly to be wished.
data.author: William Shakespeare

data.quote: Nothing in his life Became him like the leaving it.
data.author: William Shakespeare

data.quote: Death lies on her  like an untimely frost Upon the sweetest flower of all the field.
data.author: William Shakespeare

data.quote: First our pleasures die - and then Our hopes  and then our fears - and when These are dead  the debt is due  Dust claims dust - and we die too.
data.author: Percy Bysshe Shelley

data.quote: God's finger touched him  and he slept.
data.author: Lord Alfred Tennyson

data.quote: Sunset and evening star  And one clear call for me! And may there be no moaning of the bar When I put out to sea.
data.author: Lord Alfred Tennyson

data.quote: Nothing can happen more beautiful than death.
data.author: Walt Whitman

data.quote: For he who lives more lives than one More deaths than one must die.
data.author: Oscar Wilde

data.quote: A church debt is the devil's salary.
data.author: Henry Ward Beecher

data.quote: Wilt thou seal up the avenues of ill? Pay every debt as if God wrote the bill!
data.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

data.quote: If you want the time to pass quickly  just give your note for 90 days.
data.author: R. B. Thomas

data.quote: Owe no man anything.
data.author: Romans

data.quote: He that dies pays all debts.
data.author: William Shakespeare

data.quote: A national debt  if it is not excessive  will be to us a national blessing.
data.author: Alexander Hamilton

data.quote: Debt is the worst poverty.
data.author: M. G. Lichtwer

data.quote: Hood an ass with reverend purple. So you can hide his two ambitious ears  and he shall pass for a cathedral doctor.
data.author: Ben Jonson

data.quote: Proportion is almost impossible to human beings. There is no one who does not exaggerate.
data.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

data.quote: Everything that deceives may be said to enchant.
data.author: Plato

data.quote: We are never deceived  we deceive ourselves.
data.author: Goethe

data.quote: All charming people have something to conceal  usually their total dependence on the appreciation of others.
data.author: Cyril Connolly

data.quote: You k'n hide de fier  but what you guine do wid de smoke?
data.author: Joel Chandler Harris

data.quote: Deep versed in books and shallow in himself.
data.author: John Milton

data.quote: Half the work that is done in the world is to make things appear what they are not.
data.author: E. R. Beadle

data.quote: What we need is a rebirth of satire  of dissent  of irreverence  of an uncompromising insistence that phoniness is phony and platitudes are platitudinous.
data.author: Arthur Schlesinger

data.quote: If the world will be gulled  let it be gulled.
data.author: Robert Burton

data.quote: I give you bitter pills in sugar coating. The pills are harmless: the poison is in the sugar.
data.author: Stanislaw Lee

data.quote: I have known a vast quantity of nonsense talked about bad men not looking you in the face. Don't trust that conventional idea. Dishonesty will stare honesty out of countenance  any day in the week  if there is anything to be got by it.
data.author: Charles Dickens

data.quote: One should seek for the salutary in the unpleasant: if it is there  it is after all nectar. One should seek for the deceitful in the pleasant: if it is there it is after all poison.
data.author: Panchatantra

data.quote: Deceive not thy physician  confessor  nor lawyer.
data.author: George Herbert

data.quote: Frank and explicit - this is the right line to take when you wish to conceal your own mind and to confuse the mind of others.
data.author: Benjamin Disraeli

data.quote: A delusion  a mockery  and a snare.
data.author: Lord Denman

data.quote: We are never deceived  we deceive ourselves.
data.author: Goethe

data.quote: Which I wish to remark  -  And my language is plain  -  That for ways that are dark And for tricks that are vain  The heathen Chinese is peculiar.
data.author: Bret Harte

data.quote: Hateful to me as are the gates of hell  Is he who  hiding one thing in his heart  Utters another.
data.author: Homer

data.quote: You can fool some of the people all of the time  and all of the people some of the time  but you cannot fool all of the people all the time.
data.author: Abraham Lincoln

data.quote: It is double pleasure to deceive the deceiver.
data.author: Jean de la Fontaine

data.quote: "Will you walk into my parlour?" Said the spider to a fly: '"Tis the prettiest little parlour That ever you did spy."
data.author: Mary Howitt

data.quote: One is easily fooled by that which one loves.
data.author: Moliere

data.quote: Men and women everywhere must exercise deliberate selection to live wisely.
data.author: Robert Grant

data.quote: Decision and determination are the engineer and fireman of our train to opportunity and success.
data.author: Burt Lawlor

data.quote: The last of the human freedoms: to choose one's attitude in any given set of circumstances  to choose one's own way.
data.author: Viktor Frankl

data.quote: Choice of attention ... is to the inner life what choice of action is to the outer. In both cases  a man is responsible for his choice and must accept the consequences  whatever they may be.
data.author: W. H. Auden

data.quote: You are the one who must choose your place.
data.author: James Lane Allen

data.quote: Man does not simply exist  but always decides what his existence will be  what he will become in the next moment.
data.author: Viktor Frankl

data.quote: Full maturity ... is achieved by realizing that you have choices to make.
data.author: Angela Barron McBride

data.quote: Wherever you see a successful business  someone once made a courageous decision.
data.author: Peter Drucker

data.quote: Life is just a series of trying to make up your mind.
data.author: Timothy Fuller

data.quote: Life is just an endless chain of judgements. . . . The more imperfect our judgement  the less perfect our success.
data.author: B. C. Forbes

data.quote: To know just what has do be done  then to do it  comprises the whole philosophy of practical life.
data.author: Sir William Osier

data.quote: Life is like a game of cards. The hand that is dealt you represents determinism  the way you play it is free will.
data.author: Jawaharlal Nehru

data.quote: Somehow we learn who we really are and then live with that decision.
data.author: Eleanor Roosevelt

data.quote: Living is a constant process of deciding what we are going to do.
data.author: Jose Ortega

data.quote: Life is the sum of all your choices.
data.author: Albert Camus

data.quote: Life is the art of drawing sufficient conclusions from insufficient premises.
data.author: Samuel Butler

data.quote: The difficulty of life is in the choice.
data.author: George Moore

data.quote: The strongest principle of growth lies in human choice.
data.author: George Eliot

data.quote: As a man thinketh  so is he  and as a man chooseth  so is he.
data.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

data.quote: Decisions determine destiny.
data.author: Frederick Speakman

data.quote: Choices are the hinges of destiny.
data.author: Edwin Markham

data.quote: Many of life's circumstances are created by three basic choices: the disciplines you choose to keep  the people you chose to be with  and the laws you choose to obey.
data.author: Charles Millhuff

data.quote: You don't get to choose how you're going to die. Or when. You can only decide how you're going to live. Now.
data.author: Joan Baez

data.quote: Look for your choices  pick the best one  then go with it.
data.author: Pat Riley
